programme.title: Born and Bred
programme.desc: Part one of two. Tom and Deborah head off for a well-earned holiday, but their hopes of getting away from it all are dashed when they realise that Len and Linda are staying at a campsite nearby. Back in Ormston, Arthur is unexpectedly called away from his duties in the village, and the impending hospital visit by fiery local councillor Eugenia Maddox (guest star Frances de la Tour) prompts the residents to rally round to make a good impression

programme.title: Born and Bred
programme.desc: Part two of two. Ormston is engulfed by a political dispute when Tory councillor Eugenia Maddox returns to the village, armed with a plan for election, but opposition surfaces from an unexpected source. Meanwhile, Tom admits to Deborah he does not think his father is up to the job any more, but when someone close to home collapses, it is Arthur who is called upon to operate

programme.title: Born and Bred
programme.desc: Festive episode of the drama set in the Lancashire village of Ormston. Arthur gets into the yuletide spirit by playing pranks on son Tom, who is singularly unimpressed, while Deborah looks forward to the fresh start afforded by the new year, after the trauma of losing her baby. On a lighter note, news breaks that Santa and an elf have been on a crime spree, so local bobby Len and station-master Wilf set out to capture the dastardly duo, and decide the best way is to don disguise. After raiding Phyllis and Linda's wardrobes, the pair end up looking like Cinderella's ugly sisters. James Bolam, Michael French and Jenna Russell star, with John Henshaw, Peter Gunn, Maggie Steed and Naomi Radcliffe, plus guest appearances by Una Stubbs and Stephanie Cole

programme.title: Howards' Way
programme.desc: Maritime drama with the Howard family, starring Maurice Colbourne and Jan Harvey

programme.title: Howards' Way
programme.desc: Jack is certain that Tom will invest in the Mermaid boat yard

programme.title: Pie in the Sky
programme.desc: Fisher comes under suspicion following a tragic accident during a pheasant shoot on a country estate, and asks Crabbe to investigate the case. Starring Richard Griffiths, Malcolm Sinclair and Ingrid Lacey

programme.title: Pie in the Sky
programme.desc: A wealthy Irishwoman descends on the restaurant with her new husband in tow who turns out to be a figure from Margaret's wild past in swinging 1960s London. Crime drama, starring Richard Griffiths, Maggie Steed and Nigel Terry

programme.title: Pie in the Sky
programme.desc: Crabbe comes to the rescue when a regular customer is hounded by the police, but the sleuthing chef finds himself caught up in a long-running feud between notorious villain Razor Reg Costigan and his arch-rival Striker of the Yard. Offbeat drama, guest starring Nicholas Ball

programme.title: Inspector George Gently
programme.desc: It's Christmas Eve 1969 and Gently is enjoying a spot of festive cheer until he gets the news that a bank has been hit by armed robbers and he and Bacchus have work to do. The detective's hunt for the gunmen takes him into the world of skinheads and he is later faced with a dilemma. Does the law always have to be so cruel, or can he bend it just this once? Detective drama set in the north-east of England, starring Martin Shaw and Lee Ingleby, with a guest appearance by Jody Latham (Shameless)

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: The Frog and Cheetah's publican Ray Neilson branches out into tourism with a Lord of the Rings-themed attraction. Shortly afterwards his wife is discovered dead under a giant foam spider, apparently killed by an improbably powerful dose of poison from New Zealand's only native venomous spider. Suspicion soon falls on Ray and local arachnologist Chandra Singh

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: When Lady Felicia's home comes under threat, Father Brown is forced to seek help from an unlikely ally. Mark Williams and Nancy Carroll star

programme.title: Rebellion
programme.desc: The siege enters its third day, and the rebels try to get governments of other nations to recognise Irish independence. However, the British forces are closing in on them. Elizabeth, Frances and Jimmy get caught up in the fighting at the GPO

programme.title: The Split
programme.desc: Leading divorce lawyer, Hannah Stern, finds business is personal when she leaves the family firm for rivals Noble & Hale, and finally faces her father who walked out 30 years ago. Abi Morgan's drama, starring Nicola Walker and Stephen Mangan

programme.title: Miss Marple
programme.desc: Feature-length episode of the detective drama. Agatha Christie's elderly sleuth is intrigued by the case of a businessman who died in his 'counting house' with a pocketful of rye - and as she sets out to crack the 'crime by rhyme', suspicion soon falls on the household and staff at Yew Tree Lodge. Joan Hickson, Timothy West, Peter Davison, Tom Wilkinson, Stacy Dorning, Clive Merrison and Rachel Bell star

programme.title: Rebus
programme.desc: The detective angers his superiors when he tries to connect a member of Edinburgh's criminal fraternity to the shooting of two boys and a teacher at a local college. One of the victims turns out to be the son of Rebus's cousin, giving Templar the perfect excuse to take him off the case. However, the copper is determined to trace a schoolgirl he is certain holds the key to the mystery. Ken Stott stars

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Sharon gets a passion for democracy - and decides to buy Darryl's vote from Tracey for the local by-election. Robert Llewellyn guests stars, with Pauline Quirke and Linda Robson

programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Des faces a race against time to rescue Sheelagh, who is trapped in the back of a stolen taxi being driven away at high speed by the rapist, while Smithy goes undercover at a gay club where he spots Luke among the clientele. Jim plans to work a short shift ahead of his wedding day, only to get trapped in a cellar with Polly while chasing a runaway boy

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Marie begins to panic as her wedding draws nearer and Jim is nowhere to be found, unaware he is still trapped in the cellar with June, Polly and Tony _ and unfortunately, as nerves begin to fray, the officers end up sharing a few home truths about each other. Luckily, there's a new face at Sun Hill, DC Juliet Becker, who immediately proves her detective skills by locating the trapped four, meaning the wedding can go ahead as planned

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Jack Meadows tears a strip off Phil Hunter and Debbie McAllister for not reaching their targets as sergeants, and the latter's fury turns to jealousy when the DCI teams her up with new DC Juliet Becker, who displays brains and beauty in equal measure. Meanwhile, Luke Ashton's public outing by his estranged wife is the talk of the station

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Borough Commander Jane Fitzwilliam is furious that the Coal Lane Estate has been taken over by a private security firm, so Adam Okaro hatches a plan. His secret weapon is Ken Drummond, who continues moonlighting at the company, this time with his superintendent's blessing, to see what he can find out. Meanwhile, psychotic DC Cathy Bradford is back with a vengeance

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: As a firearm epidemic sweeps Sun Hill, it looks like the end of the line for Luke Ashton, who finds himself staring down the barrel of a gun being brandished by a desperate teenage crook. As the police step up their investigation against dodgy security firm boss Alan Trent, suspecting him of being the gun-runner, Debbie McAllister foolishly sets off to confront him alone

programme.title: Cranford
programme.desc: First in a two-part special. The story picks up in August 1844, two years after Miss Matty lost her beloved sister Deborah. Mr Buxton has returned to live quietly in Cranford following the death of his wife, although Miss Matty is concerned about his relationship with his son as neither seem to be coping with their bereavement. The local busybody is also worried about Peggy Bell, who lives in an isolated cottage looking after her inattentive mother and domineering brother, so she hatches a plot to bring these young residents together. However, the surprise arrival of Lady Ludlow's son Lord Septimus leads to a chain of unexpected events concerning the looming railway, and a tragedy at Matty's own house forces her to re-evaluate her opinions on the subject. Judi Dench and Jonathan Pryce star

programme.title: Cranford
programme.desc: Conclusion of the two-part special. The women of Cranford are excited about the imminent visit of Lady Glenmire, until the Hon Mrs Jamieson announces that none of them is of high enough social standing to meet her - so Miss Matty leads the Amazons in snubbing both the newcomer and her hostess. But sociable Lady Glenmire is quick to offer an olive branch by hosting a memorable Halloween party, which results in the forging of new friendships. Mr Buxton is impressed by Edward Bell's ambitions, so takes him on as land agent, only for the new employee to make a disastrous decision that has dire consequences for both himself and his sister Peggy. Meanwhile, Matty is distressed when a surprising discovery about one of her close circle results in a serious falling out among the friends, and when tragedy strikes the town, she fears Cranford may never recover. Judi Dench, Celia Imrie and Jonathan Pryce star

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's The Black Candle
programme.desc: Feature-length period drama, starring Cathy Sandford as a woman who sets out to prove her husband innocent of murdering his shiftless brother. With Samantha Bond, Nathaniel Parker and Denholm Elliott

programme.title: Sister Boniface Mysteries
programme.desc: Sister Boniface investigates a coven of witches when a human sacrifice is discovered in the woods

programme.title: Jonathan Creek
programme.desc: The unconventional hero investigates the puzzling murder of a policewoman who was found strangled to death, with the only clue to her bizarre death being reports of a stranger in a coonskin hat at the scene of the crime. Hired by a ruthless TV producer to locate the culprit, he discovers the mysterious man is not all he seems - but is soon distracted by the intervention of old acquaintance Carla Borrego. Offbeat detective drama, starring Alan Davies, Julia Sawalha and Adrian Edmondson

programme.title: Jonathan Creek
programme.desc: Jack Dee guest stars as a successful composer who wonders how his new lover has managed to miraculously regrow a full head of hair in just two days. Carla resolves to work it out for herself, while Jonathan finds himself at the centre of some unwanted attention. Light-hearted crime drama, starring Alan Davies and Julia Sawalha

programme.title: Whitechapel
programme.desc: Part one of two. Chandler and the team attend the christening of Miles' daughter, but soon find themselves dealing with a murder case when a fox runs through Whitechapel with a human arm in its mouth. More body parts from the same person are washed up from the Thames, but the detectives struggle to identify the victim. Starring Rupert Penry-Jones, Phil Davis and Steve Pemberton

programme.title: Whitechapel
programme.desc: Part two of two. Another torso is washed up from the Thames, this time at Putney Bridge, and Llewellyn finds traces of Spanish Fly, an aphrodisiac used by the infamous Marquis de Sade. The discovery propels Miles and the team into a world of dark obsessions, where romance and love take a sinister turn. Crime thriller, starring Rupert Penry-Jones, Phil Davis and Claire Rushbrook

programme.title: Luther
programme.desc: Two hoodies are shot in what appears to be a gangland crime, until a third murder victim gives Luther a vital clue - someone is killing people who have a criminal record. Sure enough the culprit soon posts a film of himself online, calling for changes to the public justice system. The race is on to find the vigilante before he strikes again - but with so many potential victims, that may be easier said than done. As ever, the DCI's personal life gets in the way of his investigation when a distraught Mary turns up after a visit from Stark and Gray - can he convince her to ever trust him again? Idris Elba and Sienna Guillory star

programme.title: Broken
programme.desc: Father Michael Kerrigan advises a hard-up parishioner struggling to feed her family while, with his mother dying, he begins to experience worrying flashbacks of his traumatic childhood. Jimmy McGovern drama about a well-respected Catholic priest presiding over a large parish on the outskirts of a major city in northern England, starring Sean Bean and Anna Friel

programme.title: Walter's War
programme.desc: Drama based on the life of Walter Tull, a black professional footballer who enlists in the Army during the First World War. While recuperating at home from a bout of trench fever, Walter learns he has been recommended for officer training at Gailes, Ayrshire - but must overcome prejudice, as well as his own demons, before returning to the front. Starring OT Fagbenle, Ewan Stewart, Kwame Kwei-Armah and Dugald Bruce-Lockhart

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Trouble lies in store for Sharon when she finds romance, and Tracey starts a business venture with Dorien. Comedy, starring Pauline Quirke, Linda Robson and Lesley Joseph

programme.title: Pie in the Sky
programme.desc: Crabbe investigates a crooked takeaway whose staff he suspects of cooking up a burglary, but as he delves deeper into the case he finds an altogether more sinister operation. Crime drama, starring Richard Griffiths, Maggie Steed, Samantha Janus and Malcolm Sinclair

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Part one of two. An American acquaintance of Lovejoy's is sold some fake antiques, so he sets out to exact revenge on the dealer responsible - and make a little money into the bargain. Linda Gray and Brian Blessed guest star, with Ian McShane

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Dom's life is hanging in the balance, while Hanssen questions whether he did the right thing. Ange is devastated when she learns that things have not gone to plan, and Dom will face life-changing consequences of his injuries. Sacha vows to save Jodie's baby, and begins to understand the ongoing impact of her relationship with her mother. Cameron announces his intention to make a career change

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: There's panic in a community centre when a performing snake is on the loose, and an Asian man is the victim of a vicious racial attack

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: A group of teenagers threatens a bus driver, so Reg Hollis steps in to help _ but when one of the kids whips out a gun and another gets behind the wheel, the PC becomes Sun Hill's answer to Keanu Reeves as the vehicle speeds away. Polly Page is disappointed to hear her doctor friend Owen Preston is suspected of a violent assault, and even more shocked when he asks a massive favour of her

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Little Mo's furious that Billy killed a poor little mouse. The Square compete over who can give the new family the best welcome. Sam confronts Phil about family loyalty

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: The residents attend an eye-opening house-warming party as Dan Ferreira welcomes his guests to 'Graceland'

programme.title: Hamish Macbeth
programme.desc: The policeman accompanies climbers on a hill trek, but they find themselves in trouble after ignoring his warnings. Robert Carlyle stars

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: When a man who arranged to meet Lovejoy at the local cricket game dies suddenly, it falls to the antiques dealer to find the fortune that was promised to the widow. The unusual legacy includes a forged snuff box. Ian McShane stars

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Part two of two. Dawn rushes to be by Andrew's side as he hovers near death, while Sam is tormented by the thought that he could have done more to help his stricken colleague. Joanna wrestles with a medical dilemma as her teenage patient recoils from the prospect of undergoing the risky operation to remove her brain tumour. Starring Gary Mavers, Joseph Millson and Haydn Gwynne

programme.title: May to December
programme.desc: Alec and Zoe cannot believe their luck as everything in their life seems to be going right for once - until an unexpected house guest shatters the peace. Comedy, starring Anton Rodgers, Lesley Dunlop and Carolyn Pickles

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Betting fever sweeps Slade Prison, but the stakes rise too high for some of the inmates, stretching honour among thieves to the limit. Vintage comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Billy and Alvin learn that Truly's ex-wife is trying to find him, and waste no time in gleefully tormenting their pal with the news of a strange woman's appearance in town. Long-running comedy, starring Peter Sallis and Frank Thornton

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Clegg, Truly, Alvin and Billy encounter a stranger who is determined to travel by canal to Ilkley in an inflatable swan. However, when punctures disrupt the man's dream, Entwistle is on hand to ensure the voyage goes to plan. Tommy Cannon and Bobby Ball guest star

programme.title: The Last Detective
programme.desc: Davies is saddened by the death of a harmless local tramp known for his penchant for collecting waste paper in a pram. The detective's instincts, along with the intervention of social services officer Jemma Duval, lead him to pursue the case, uncovering a wartime mystery along the way. Norman Wisdom stars alongside Peter Davison and Sean Hughes

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: While Sasha is occupied with a training course, the boys' investigations take them to a lookalike agency, where their top two acts were found dead in an apparent double suicide 13 years ago. In an industry reliant on the art of the illusion and their suspects intent on giving them the run around, Ted, Steve and Danny are convinced there's more to this case than first meets the eye. Steve is thrilled when their enquiries take them to the door of one of his football heroes, but his glee is short-lived. Detective drama, starring Denis Lawson

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: UCOS looks into the murder of a private investigator who was stabbed through the heart in a suspected robbery gone wrong. The answers may lie with the victim's last three cases, but it'll take the whole team's expertise to crack the codes within his mysterious notebook. The movements of a rare stamp could hold the key to the investigation - if only UCOS could track it down. Meanwhile, Steve has problems when he rents out his flat

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The team is called to the scene of a drive-by shooting, but the case proves less clear-cut than expected when evidence emerges that someone returned fire. The vehicle used is soon traced to an abandoned industrial unit, where a decomposing corpse is uncovered - and Nikki resolves to find out the true cause of death. Guest starring Craig Kelly and Freema Agyeman

programme.title: Kingdom
programme.desc: Lyle helps horse trainer Herb Griffiths lease a field for his prize racer Market Mischief, but finds his loyalties tested when travellers take up residence there and are then accused of stealing the racehorse. Peter has been instructed by his client Mrs Collins to file for divorce from her cross-dressing husband, but the optimistic solicitor believes a reconciliation is possible with his intervention. Hill returns to seek payment on Simon's debt. Robert Bathurst guests

programme.title: Holby City

programme.desc: In an episode celebrating the 50th anniversary of the Welsh Surfing Federation, John Craven meets Linda Sharp, the UK's first female European champion who helped shape e Welsh surfing culture in the 1970s. He also joins Swansea's Surfers Against Sewage at one of their monthly beach cleans. Margherita Taylor discovers the magical landscape of the Kenfig sand dune system, Joe Crowley explores how nature could be threatened by the UK's growing demand for water, and Adam Henson catches up with young farmers

programme.title: Spy in the Ocean
programme.desc: Extraordinary relationships among the creatures of the ocean, from spider crabs watching each other's backs for predators while they shed their shells, to fish cleaning the skins and teeth of hammerhead sharks. Off the coast of Costa Rica, a team of spy cameras capture a megapod of spinner dolphins, numbering in their thousands, working together to drive the flying fish from below while tuna and frigate birds pursue them in the air

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Sefton Park in Liverpool, where treasures include cufflinks made from 2,000-year-old coins, a letter from Kate Bush to one of her fans, a portrait from the English Civil War and an early version of the Beatles logo made for a drumkit. Fiona meets the descendent of a local hero, James Clarke, who moved to the city from Guyana at the turn of the 20th century and used his swimming skills to save countless lives in Liverpool's docks

programme.title: Ten Pound Poms
programme.desc: Annie is compelled to make a stand for migrants and stages a peaceful protest, but things get quickly out of hand and Pattie is badly hurt. Kate returns amidst the carnage to find a surprise visitor waiting and Sheila's desperation spirals

programme.title: In the Heart of the Sea (2015)
programme.desc: A whaling ship sets sail from New England in 1820, only to come under attack from a gigantic whale that seems to want revenge on them. In the aftermath of the attack, the surviving members of the crew face further physical and moral challenges as they try to stay alive on the open sea. Fact-based historical adventure, starring Chris Hemsworth, Cillian Murphy and Ben Whishaw

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Claimed and Shamed
programme.desc: A young woman who tried to cover up a car crash calls up to confess, and the party's over for a wedding guest who lost £26,000 of bling on the dancefloor

programme.title: Dirty Rotten Scammers
programme.desc: Mother and daughter Mavis and Michelle Ackerley introduce stories of digital crime. Sally's inheritance was lost to scammers when they hacked into her solicitor's email account. Kent Police tell the story of disgruntled employee turned hacker who threatened 150 jobs

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: The progress of properties in East Suffolk, South Yorkshire and Cambridgeshire. Jacqui Joseph heads to Lowestoft to see a one bed flat that's just a stone's throw from the beach. Dion Dublin is in Mexborough to visit a two-bed end-of-terrace in need of a full refurbishment. Tommy Walsh is in Whittlesey casting his eye over a three-bedroom detached house that is seriously lacking in kerb appeal

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles presents the show from Leominster and learns about the heritage of one of the town's oldest timber buildings. Kate Bliss and Philip Serrell assist the teams

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Nina gives Rosie a task, Zara tries to deal with Miles, and Kirsty goes on her first VPAS visit, and helps a broken family

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph explores Beaconsfield recycling centre in Buckinghamshire, selecting a pair of worn-down wicker chairs, an old coal scuttle and a pair of bedside tables

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson explores the countryside of North and West Yorkshire with a couple from West Sussex, who want a home with a big workshop for woodworking

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and Lee Burkhill come up with plans to transform an overgrown garden in Southampton into a tropical paradise perfect for friends and family to relax in

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: Single dad Martin calls on the team to give his daughter a multi-purpose bedroom. With just 24 hours and a limited budget, they construct an art desk with clever storage

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong hosts the quiz in which contestants try to record the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Lauren Laverne reveals the correct answers and comments on the players' scores

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Jermaine Jenas present the first visit of the week to the One Show studio, featuring the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Elaine hosts a Battle of the Dads karaoke competition at the Vic and Vinny threatens Eve. Ben and Jay try to connect with Lexi but they clash over the idea of her speaking at Lola's funeral. Lily and Ricky meet with social services

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Around one in seven in the UK now takes an antidepressant. Globally they have made the pharmaceutical industry billions. When the current generation of drugs was launched 35 years ago, they promised a safe and effective treatment, free from the side effects of older medicines. But have they lived up to those claims? Whilst many people say they have benefited from taking them, Panorama reveals evidence of some companies trying to conceal concerns about their drugs and follows patients who've suffered serious side effects as they continue their fight to be heard

programme.title: Best Interests
programme.desc: Nicci's campaign becomes national news, but she has cause to hesitate when she discovers she will have to make Samantha appear to be incompetent as a doctor. Katie has an argument with Hannah that leads in turn to a confrontation between her and her mother. Andrew realises there may no longer a place for him at his daughter's bedside

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Clive Myrie hosts, with actor Munya Chawawa and journalist Helen Lewis joining team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop as they delve into the news

programme.title: Glow Up: Britain's Next Make-Up Star
programme.desc: The semi-finalists are tasked with getting celebrities red carpet ready at the Brit Awards under the watchful eye of MUA to the stars, Hector Espinal. At Glow Up Studios, the artists draw upon their university projects to wow the judges and secure their spot in the final. In the Face Off elimination, the bottom two are asked to produce a spider lash

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Betty learns to play with others on her first day

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The squirrels have a dance-off with Chippo and the Rock Slippy Crew

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Evil Pea pretends to be Supertato's sidekick

programme.title: Shaun the Sheep
programme.desc: The farmer receives a mystery gift from his antipodean cousin and is convinced that it holds magical powers

programme.title: Dennis & Gnasher Unleashed!
programme.desc: Dennis is exasperated to find that he is unable to land himself in detention

programme.title: Boy Girl Dog Cat Mouse Cheese
programme.desc: Gramps starts spending a lot of time with mean Miss Molly

programme.title: The Deep
programme.desc: The Nektons help locate a legendary glass cabinet guarded by a terrifying creature

programme.title: OOglies Funsize
programme.desc: A pear and an apple perform a strongman act

programme.title: Game on Grandparents
programme.desc: Phoenix and Jon go head to head with Charlie and Anne as they compete for the chance to make it to the Grand Final and become ultimate champions

programme.title: One Zoo Three
programme.desc: The brothers check up on how green they have been, while a tiger gets stuck into an old barrel, and a ring-tailed lemur has a special, sparkly snack

programme.title: Newsround
programme.desc: Current affairs reports aimed at a younger audience

programme.title: Blue Peter
programme.desc: The team shows how to make an ingenious Father's Day card that doubles up as a paper aeroplane, while Joel finds out if he has what it takes to make it as a firefighter

programme.title: Pooch Perfect
programme.desc: Sheridan Smith and her canine co-host Stanley open the doors of the Pooch Parlour to the last of the 16 dog groomers. First they tackle a quartet of cute Pomeranians, having to achieve a perfect pom-pom ball shape using scissors only. Then four party pooches hit the Dogwalk as a family of poodles and a Yorkshire terrier strut their stuff, having been given a makeover by the contestants. Who will judges Verity Hardcastle and Colin Taylor choose to go through to the quarter-finals?

programme.title: Family Cooking Showdown
programme.desc: The families tackle a Catalan fish stew in a 'Taste It Now Make It' challenge. They are then given a whole salmon and tasked with creating a selection of dishes that will use as much of the fish as possible. The families are pushed to their limits as they vie to stay in the competition. Presented by Angellica Bell and Tommy Banks

programme.title: Food & Drink
programme.desc: Tom Kerridge is joined by Cyrus Todiwala (The Incredible Spice Men) to discuss the benefits of wholesome food, with the host challenging the award-winning Indian chef to come up with an alternative take on a curry to rival his own spice-crusted tuna salad. Comedienne Arabella Weir tries her hardest to fall in love with salad, and drinks expert Joe Wadsack picks a selection of healthy red wines

programme.title: Talking Pictures
programme.desc: Sylvia Syms narrates a history of Westerns, covering the golden age of the 1940s and '50s, the European influence of the Spaghetti Westerns, and the stars that keep the western alive and popular even today. Featuring interviews with Gary Cooper, James Stewart, Yul Brynner, Paul Newman, John Wayne and Clint Eastwood.

programme.title: The Magnificent Seven (1960)
programme.desc: Oppressed Mexican villagers cross the border into America looking to buy guns to defend their homes and crops from bandits. Instead they encounter an enigmatic loner who persuades them to hire a band of gunslingers to teach the villagers how to fight before the marauders return. Western, with Yul Brynner, Steve McQueen, Charles Bronson, Robert Vaughn, James Coburn and Eli Wallach

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: An insight into the endangered spectacled bears that live in reduced numbers in Peru, and about which little was known until recent years when zoologists were forced to reassess their preconception of them as gentle, vegetarian creatures. Narrated by Stephen Fry

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul Martin presents from Sandon Hall in Staffordshire, where antiques experts Christina Trevanion and Charles Hanson uncover a few gems including a silver ladle with a surprise in its bowl and a train set brought in by the son of William Moorcroft, the world-famous ceramicist. Plus, Paul finds out about the epic 18th-century voyage by the second Englishman to circumnavigate the globe

programme.title: Hidden Treasures of the National Trust
programme.desc: Cameras focus on the teams at work at the 'big houses' of Northern Ireland. Highlights of the final episode include the battle to save unique dodo and dinosaur statues in a garden, the hidden story behind a portrait, and a Victorian garden seat's restoration to its former glory

programme.title: Dad's Army
programme.desc: Sgt Wilson struggles to concentrate on his Home Guard duties when he has a personal problem to contend with. Classic comedy, starring John Le Mesurier and Arthur Lowe

programme.title: Trooping the Colour Highlights
programme.desc: The ceremony to mark the official birthday of King Charles, performed by British and Commonwealth army regiments, from Horse Guards Parade in London

programme.title: Today at the Test
programme.desc: England v Australia. Action from day two of the First Test in the five-match Ashes series from Edgbaston, Birmingham. The Aussies regained the famous urn in with a series victory on home soil in 2017-18 and have twice successfully defended it since, drawing 2-2 in England in 2019 and winning in Australia in 2021-22

programme.title: George Michael at the BBC
programme.desc: The much-missed singer-songwriter was one of Britain's best-loved and most acclaimed music stars, rising to superstardom in the 1980s phenomenon with Wham!, before his subsequent solo work took his career to a whole new level. This collection of appearances on the BBC by the singer-songwriter both solo and as part of Wham! includes performances of Club Tropicana, Freedom, Faith, Outside and Amazing

programme.title: Later... with Jools Holland
programme.desc: LA-based gospel-soul trio Gabriels perform songs from their second album, Angels & Queens: Part Two, and Malian musician Fatoumata Diawara demonstrates her blend of contemporary and traditional sounds, including a collaboration with Damon Albarn. Stereophonics frontman Kelly Jones returns with his new project Far from Saints, with the Wind and the Wave's Patty Lynn and Dwight Baker, Fontaines DC singer Grian Chatten makes his solo debut on the show, as does rising soul star Elmiene. Sharleen Spiteri joins Jools for a chat to discuss Texas's recently released greatest hits album and their forthcoming performance on the Pyramid Stage at Glastonbury

programme.title: George Michael: Live in London
programme.desc: Footage of the award-winning singer-songwriter's two shows at Earls Court in August 2008, which were part of his record-breaking 25 Live tour. The artist performs renditions of his most popular hits to a sell-out crowd, including I'm Your Man, Everything She Wants, Careless Whisper, Faith, Freedom! '90, Too Funky, A Different Corner, Amazing and Outside

programme.title: Glastonbury
programme.desc: A look back at last year's Glastonbury Festival, where the likes of Paul McCartney, Billie Eilish, Kendrick Lamar, Diana Ross, Sam Fender, Olivia Rodrigo, Years & Years, Little Simz and many more all took to the stage in what was a memorable return to Worthy Farm

programme.title: Africa Rising with Afua Hirsch
programme.desc: Writer and broadcaster Afua Hirsch explores how young creatives are reinventing culture across Africa. She begins in Morocco, where she meets renowned photographer Hassan Hajjaj, who is updating traditional Moroccan style, goes riding with Tbourida horse rider Amal Amhari and explores Amazigh rug weaving with artist Sarah Allaoui. Afua also meets the country's new superstar singer Rym Fikri

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The team are Birmingham-bound for the annual Gardeners' World Live event. Monty Don, Arit Anderson, Adam Frost, Sue Kent, Carol Klein, Joe Swift, Rachel de Thame and Frances Tophill focus on design inspiration in the show gardens and the latest plants and flowers in the floral marquee

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Hamza Yassin visits the Argyll Coast and Islands, which was designated Hope Spot status in 2019 because it is home to the only nursery in the world for the endangered flapper skate. He joins marine biologist Chris Rickard as he conducts research into these mysterious creatures of the deep. Adam Henson looks at the robots and artificial intelligence being developed that promise to revolutionise UK agriculture. And John Craven launches this year's photo competition in aid of Children in Need

programme.title: Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: Carole Baxter and Calum Clunie have advice for productive gardening in small spaces, checking the progress of the range of tomatoes chosen because they would grow well on a windowsill. George Anderson is on his allotment in Joppa, where he plants out his pumpkins, and there is a visit to an amateur gardener who has been inspired by her volunteer work at Cowden Japanese Garden

programme.title: Landward
programme.desc: Dougie Vipond cycles along a trail in Glentress Forest in the Borders that is being used in the UCI Cycling World Championships this summer, finding out how the wild habitat is being protected. Arlene Stuart visits an estate in the Angus glens that is working to increase the number of barn owls, seeing some of this year's chicks up close as they're checked and tagged as part of a conservation project

programme.title: The Edible Garden
programme.desc: Alys Fowler plants root crops and leafy vegetables in her urban garden, including kale, Swiss chard and beetroot, before preparing dishes of rhubarb and raspberry pie, and beetroot and yoghurt soup. She also collects a good supply of eggs from her two chickens

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt presents more highlights from the series, offering viewers a chance to revisit some of their favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen

programme.title: Family Cooking Showdown
programme.desc: The three remaining families make a meal out of produce from judge Tommy Banks's farm, before recreating Angellica's favourite desserts as they fight for a place in the final

programme.title: Rick Stein's Spain
programme.desc: The chef heads for the region of Extremadura, famous for paprika and Iberico ham. He then concludes his exploration of the country by driving south in his camper van to the city of Seville - the capital of tapas and flamenco

programme.title: The African Queen (1951)
programme.desc: A prim missionary is forced to flee her home in German East Africa at the outbreak of the First World War. The only transport available comes courtesy of a gin-sodden riverboat captain, and as the bickering and unlikely travelling companions make their perilous journey, she persuades him to aid the British war effort. John Huston's romantic adventure, starring an Oscar-winning Humphrey Bogart, Katharine Hepburn and Robert Morley

programme.title: How to Marry a Millionaire (1953)
programme.desc: Three women rent a luxurious New York apartment as part of a scheme to get their claws into wealthy husbands - but their plans become unstuck when all three start to fall for men with good hearts and empty pockets. Comedy, starring Betty Grable, Marilyn Monroe, Lauren Bacall, William Powell, Cameron Mitchell, David Wayne, Rory Calhoun and Fred Clark

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: From Lulworth Castle in Dorset, where antiques experts David Fletcher and Mark Stacey find the best items to take to auction

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: The sewers take on new challenges in Reduce Reuse Recycle week, starting with making a pair of trousers with zero-waste before tackling a mountain of wasted tote bags in the Transformation Challenge. For a Made to Measure outfit, the sewers have been asked to source second-hand crochet blankets

programme.title: Stanley Tucci: Searching for Italy
programme.desc: The actor starts his exploration of Tuscany in the company of his parents Stan and Joan, then meets chef and restaurateur Fabio Picchi, who shows him the region's signature dish of bistecca alla fiorentina. Renaissance scholar Elisabetta Di Giugno takes Stanley on a tour of Florence's wine bars, before he attends a threshing festival to celebrate the importance and tradition of bread

programme.title: Today at the Test
programme.desc: England v Australia. Action from day three of the First Test in the five-match Ashes series from Edgbaston, Birmingham. The last series was one to forget for England with the Aussies winning four matches and drawing the other one on home soil in 2021-22, but they will expect to fare better on this occasion

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: Cuba's isolation has helped preserve many of its natural riches, creating unspoiled landscapes home to many enchanting animals. In the first of two parts, cameraman, director and naturalist Colin Stafford-Johnson explores corners of the country that few outsiders have seen. Amongst the wonders he encounters is the bee hummingbird, the world's tiniest bird, and the spectacle of thousands of crabs migrating en masse. In this authored odyssey, the natural magic of one Earth's most intriguing countries is revealed

programme.title: Gods of Tennis
programme.desc: A look at how Czech-born Martina Navratilova began to dominate Wimbledon in the 1980s, but struggled to be as adored as her big US rival Chris Evert. At the heart of this story is Navratilova's search for acceptance, which culminated in an ambition to become the greatest player to ever grace Centre Court

programme.title: We Love Glastonbury
programme.desc: Famous fans recall their favourite performances and stand-out moments from the festival over the years. Noel Gallagher, Self Esteem, Jessie Ware, Nish Kumar, Kerry Godliman, Joe Wicks and more reflect on seeing the likes of Pet Shop Boys, Beyoncé, Janelle Monáe, Foo Fighters, Miley Cyrus and the Killers at the festival

programme.title: Glastonbury: 50 Years and Counting
programme.desc: An updated version of Francis Whately's social and musical history of the festival, told through the testimonies of its principal curators Michael and Emily Eavis, as well as artists who have appeared there. Contributors include Aswad, Chris Martin, Dua Lipa, Ed O'Brien, Fatboy Slim, Florence Welch, Johnny Marr, Linda Lewis, Orbital, Noel Gallagher, the Levellers, Thom Yorke and Stormzy. Featuring performances from 2022's edition, including Wet Leg on the Park Stage, Greta Thunberg's speech on the Pyramid Stage and interviews with performers Arlo Parks and Billie Eilish

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the topical debate from Deeside, Wales, inviting a panel of politicians and other guests to answer questions from an invited audience on subjects that have made the headlines over the past week

programme.title: Predator: The Secret Scandal of J-Pop
programme.desc: Mobeen Azhar investigates the untold story of Japanese pop mogul Johnny Kitagawa and the allegations of sexual abuse against him by some of the boys in his talent agency. Despite the claims, the Japanese media has remained largely silent, even after the music mogul's death in 2019. Mobeen visits Japan to speak to those who say Kitagawa abused them, and find out how the allegations have affected his legacy

programme.title: Gods of Tennis
programme.desc: A look at the fierce rivalry between Bjorn Borg and John McEnroe, and how their sporting prowess brought with it an intense level of media scrutiny as well as celebrity and glamour to Centre Court. While McEnroe's bad-boy antics infuriates the tabloids and the Wimbledon hierarchy, it was the seemingly calm and collected Borg who struggled to cope

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: In Telford, Shropshire, Charlie Dimmock and Chris Hull set out to design a cat friendly 'enchanted' garden. Lesley would love an enchanted space suitable for her beloved cat Gizmo to share with her, and importantly, her very own outdoor gin bar to relax with her friends. She has £3,500 to spare, hoping Charlie and Chris can make her dreams come true.

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: The team is in Bedford to help a family-of-six bursting at the seams. They have just 24 hours and a limited budget to turn a dining room into a much-needed bedroom. The helpers also create an area for the family to eat, transforming an old utility space into a breakfast bar

programme.title: Coast to Coast Food Festival
programme.desc: Colin Murray and Edith Bowman explore St George's Market in Belfast and meet a social media sensation who reveals the secrets of healthy and inexpensive one-pot meals. Farmer Jim Smith discovers how one farm is turning its oats into milk, and food journalist Leyla Kazim is in Norfolk to find out the secrets of producing mustard, while farmer Meinir Howells reveals just why Welsh lamb is so popular

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo begins this leg of his journey at Liverpool's historic waterfront, where he visits the International Slavery Museum at Royal Albert Dock, before heading underground to discover one of the most important and secret rooms of the Second World War, the Royal Navy's Western Approaches Headquarters. His next stop is Crosby on the Merseyside coastline in Sefton, before making his way north to Blackpool, the last stop on this leg of his journey

programme.title: Nicky Campbell
programme.desc: Calls on the day's talking points, with views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 (calls are free from mobiles and landlines)

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: The latest stories from Westminster and beyond

programme.title: Tennis: Queen's
programme.desc: The cinch Championships. Clare Balding presents coverage of day one of the men's grass-court tournament at Queen's Club, featuring matches from the first round. Matteo Berrettini has won this title and each of the last two years and returns in a bid to complete a hat-trick. However, he will face tough competition from the likes of British stars Andy Murray, Cameron Norrie and Dan Evans, world number one Carlos Alcaraz and the in-form Holger Rune

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Former winners Rickie Haywood-Williams, Sally Phillips, Vikki Stone and Dan Walker test their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games across the week

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo explores the Britain of his youth, starting at Preston's Fulwood Barracks and heading to Bury Bolton Street Station in Greater Manchester

programme.title: Today at the Test
programme.desc: England v Australia. Action from the fourth day of the First Test in the five-match Ashes series from Edgbaston, Birmingham. Australia ended an eight-match unbeaten Test run against all opposition for the hosts at this venue with a 251-run triumph here in 2019. England then went on to lose to New Zealand in their next Test here in 2021, but they did end that losing run with a seven-wicket win against India last year

programme.title: Your Body Uncovered with Kate Garraway
programme.desc: Kate and Dr Guddi Singh meet people with everyday medical conditions and take them through immersive consultations to help better understand their illnesses. In the first episode, Kate and Guddi meet Hilda, a fashion influencer suffering from fibroids, who confronts her debilitating condition, as well as grandmother Trudi struggling with a frozen shoulder

programme.title: Once Upon a Time in Northern Ireland
programme.desc: A look at how after decades of violence a breakthrough was reached in the form of the Good Friday Agreement in 1998, after years of talks at government level and with the intervention of US president Bill Clinton. The programme also examines the legacy of the Troubles, with its effects on victims and survivors being lasting and significant

programme.title: Glastonbury Anthems
programme.desc: A selection of classic songs performed at Worthy Farm over the years of the festival, with this edition featuring appearances by Radiohead, Robbie Williams and Blondie

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: he day's important national and international news stories, presented by Victoria Derbyshire

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Gods of Tennis
programme.desc: A look at how Czech-born Martina Navratilova began to dominate Wimbledon in the 1980s, but struggled to be as adored as her big US rival Chris Evert. At the heart of this story is Navratilova's search for acceptance, which culminated in an ambition to become the greatest player to ever grace Centre Court

programme.title: The Man Who Knew Infinity (2015)
programme.desc: The story of the life and academic career of the pioneering Indian mathematician, Srinivasa Ramanujan, and his friendship with his mentor at Trinity College, Cambridge, Professor GH Hardy. Biographical drama, starring Jeremy Irons, Dev Patel and Malcolm Sinclair

programme.title: Waterloo Road
programme.desc: Kim rallies the troops for a surprise Ofsted inspection and Joe's day goes from bad to worse while the whole school is watching. Danny helps with the school knife crime initiative and Kai comes to Nicky's aid when she finds herself caught up with the wrong people

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Hamza Yassin visits the Argyll Coast and Islands, which was designated Hope Spot status in 2019 because it is home to the only nursery in the world for the endangered flapper skate. He joins marine biologist Chris Rickard as he conducts research into these mysterious creatures of the deep. Adam Henson looks at the robots and artificial intelligence being developed that promise to revolutionise UK agriculture. And John Craven launches this year's photo competition in aid of Children in Need

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Caribbean with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: The adventurer travels around the islands and mainland coast of the Caribbean Sea, beginning on Hispaniola. He joins the Dominican Republic police's anti-narcotics division, before crossing the border to Haiti to see the notorious tented slums of Cite Soleil, while also discovering a vibrant, colourful and thriving side to the country. He ends this leg of his journey in Puerto Rico, an archipelago that is a territory of the United States, and examines the legacy of bombing and weapons testing on the island of Vieques

programme.title: Voyages of Discovery
programme.desc: Paul Rose investigates Norwegian explorer Fridtjof Nansen's expedition to reach the North Pole in 1893. Despite his failure to persuade any scientists to join him, Nansen became a pioneer of polar exploration techniques when he allowed his ship to become stuck in pack ice, hoping it would drift toward his destination

programme.title: Kursk: The Last Mission (2018)
programme.desc: Explosions aboard a Russian submarine cause it to sink during a naval exercise in the Barents Sea, leaving 23 survivors trapped on the ocean floor. For the next seven days, members of a rescue team frantically work to reach the men before their dwindling oxygen supply runs out. Fact-based drama, starring Matthias Schoenaerts, Léa Seydoux and Colin Firth

programme.title: Aliens: The Big Thinkers
programme.desc: The search for extraterrestrials is no longer sci-fi - it is a question engaging some of the greatest minds in science. This documentary gets inside the minds of scientists exploring the possibilities of what could be out there, including Professor Martin Rees, the Astronomer Royal, who thinks the common idea of organic aliens is all wrong

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc: The scientists scouring the universe for signs of extraterrestrial life, including the film researchers at the Green Bank Telescope searching for radio signals from 'Tabby's Star', a star so mysterious some scientists believe it might be surrounded by a Dyson Sphere - a vast energy collector built by advanced aliens. The film also features the 2006 discovery by husband and wife team Duncan Lorimer and Maura McLaughlin of an enigmatic signal from space, known as a fast radio burst, and its subsequent explanations

programme.title: Hancock's Half Hour
programme.desc: Hancock decides to donate blood but is aghast to find out how much he has to give. When he discovers he has a rare blood type, he wants to find out where it will end up

programme.title: Whatever Happened to the Likely Lads?
programme.desc: Bob and Terry seek sanctuary from the news so they can watch TV highlights of an England v Bulgaria football match without knowing the result, but they are pursued by the relentless Flint, who has bet them they cannot escape the final score. James Bolam and Rodney Bewes star, with Brian Glover and Donald Gee

programme.title: Voyages of Discovery
programme.desc: Paul Rose investigates Norwegian explorer Fridtjof Nansen's expedition to reach the North Pole in 1893. Despite his failure to persuade any scientists to join him, Nansen became a pioneer of polar exploration techniques when he allowed his ship to become stuck in pack ice, hoping it would drift toward his destination

programme.title: Caribbean with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: The adventurer travels around the islands and mainland coast of the Caribbean Sea, beginning on Hispaniola. He joins the Dominican Republic police's anti-narcotics division, before crossing the border to Haiti to see the notorious tented slums of Cite Soleil, while also discovering a vibrant, colourful and thriving side to the country. He ends this leg of his journey in Puerto Rico, an archipelago that is a territory of the United States, and examines the legacy of bombing and weapons testing on the island of Vieques

programme.title: Blankety Blank
programme.desc: Joe Brown, Bernie Clifton, Ian Krankie, Janette Krankie, Janice Long and Anthea Turner fill in the blanks on the comedy game show, hosted by Les Dawson

programme.title: Pop Quiz
programme.desc: Two teams comprising Cliff Richard, Cheryl Baker, Stuart Adamson, Micky Dolenz, Nick Heyward and Hal Lindes compete to show who knows the most about music. Mike Read asks the questions. From June 1983. First broadcast in June 1983

programme.title: BBC Cardiff Singer of the World
programme.desc: The competition reaches its climax with the final from St David's Hall. Over the past week, 16 of the world's most outstanding young opera singers gathered in Cardiff to compete for the prestigious prize - now just five remain to sing again. Petroc Trelawny and Josie d'Arby present full coverage, joined by Jamie Barton, the American mezzo-soprano who won the competition 10 years ago, and Neal Davies, the Welsh bass-baritone who won the Song Prize title in 1991. The finalists perform with the BBC National Orchestra of Wales, conducted by Ryan Bancroft and Michael Christie

programme.title: Just Call Me Martina
programme.desc: Sue Barker presents a profile of former tennis star Martina Navratilova, documenting her achievements on the court in a professional career that spanned more than 30 years and saw her win Grand Slam titles in four different decades. Martina also goes back to her home town of Revnice in the Czech Republic, and allows the cameras to film her wedding in New York and the celebrations in Miami. Featuring contributions by Chris Evert, Elton John, Stephen Fry, Billie Jean King, Novak Djokovic, Rafael Nadal, Pam Shriver and Rod Laver

programme.title: Sue Barker: Our Wimbledon
programme.desc: The presenter travels the globe meeting Wimbledon greats such as Andy Murray, Roger Federer, Pete Sampras, Billie Jean King and Martina Navratilova

programme.title: Africa Turns the Page: The Novels That Shaped a Continent
programme.desc: Nigerian-born presenter and historian David Olusoga explores the story of the African novel, and a time when writers including Chinua Achebe, Ngugi wa Thiong'o and Wole Soyinka became the conscience of a continent. In their wake, the African novel was to spread around the world - writers of the African diaspora such as Buchi Emecheta and Ben Okri created masterpieces from their adopted home of the United Kingdom. Featuring contributions by Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie, Aminatta Forna and 2019 Booker winner Bernardine Evaristo

programme.title: Just Call Me Martina
programme.desc: Sue Barker presents a profile of former tennis star Martina Navratilova, documenting her achievements on the court in a professional career that spanned more than 30 years and saw her win Grand Slam titles in four different decades. Martina also goes back to her home town of Revnice in the Czech Republic, and allows the cameras to film her wedding in New York and the celebrations in Miami. Featuring contributions by Chris Evert, Elton John, Stephen Fry, Billie Jean King, Novak Djokovic, Rafael Nadal, Pam Shriver and Rod Laver

programme.title: Aliens: The Big Thinkers
programme.desc: The search for extraterrestrials is no longer sci-fi - it is a question engaging some of the greatest minds in science. This documentary gets inside the minds of scientists exploring the possibilities of what could be out there, including Professor Martin Rees, the Astronomer Royal, who thinks the common idea of organic aliens is all wrong

programme.title: The Lakes with Paul Rose
programme.desc: Coniston Water isn't the biggest of Cumbria's lakes - but it's one of the most iconic and the place where Donald Campbell died trying to break the world water speed record. Paul meets Campbell's daughter Gina and crew member Robbie Robinson, who was there on the fateful day in January 1967 when Bluebird somersaulted and crashed on the water. The explorer also enters a Lakeland bike ride with a difference before ending his visit with a spot of rock climbing at Dow Crag before the ascent of one of the area's best known hills, The Old Man of Coniston

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Made in Britain
programme.desc: Fred takes his traction engine to Scotland, where it becomes the first vehicle of its kind to cross the Forth Road Bridge under its own steam. He also visits the Falkirk Wheel and one of the region's few surviving traditional ironworks

programme.title: An Art Lovers' Guide
programme.desc: Historian Janina Ramirez and art critic Alastair Sooke embark on cultural city breaks, offering insights into the most famous locations and uncovering hidden gems and untold stories to reveal how religion, revolution and trailblazing individuals can shape the art - and soul - of a metropolis. They begin by examining the art and design of the Dutch capital Amsterdam, along the way discovering how its culture reflects the liberal attitudes, appetite for global trade and love of home comforts that helped shape the character of this city

programme.title: Windrush
programme.desc: First of a four-part series documenting the experiences of Caribbean immigrants to the UK, beginning with the arrival of the troop ship Empire Windrush on June 22, 1948 carrying 500 West Indians. Britain's first taste of mass immigration this century was soured by racial hostility which escalated in the years to come, culminating in the notorious Nottingham and Notting Hill riots of 1958

programme.title: Windrush
programme.desc: The 1958 Notting Hill riots and Britain's first racial murder appeared to predict a bleak future for the immigrants who arrived on the Windrush. Archive footage reveals how, in the face of adversity, black communities and churches sprang up across the country, offering new hope to those starting their lives afresh - until Enoch Powell's infamous Rivers of Blood speech in 1968 looked set to wreck their efforts

programme.title: Windrush
programme.desc: The examination of immigration of Caribbeans to Britain continues with a look at the race riots of the 1970s, and the dilemma faced by children of early migrants over whether to define themselves as British

programme.title: Windrush
programme.desc: The series charting the fate of immigrants to Britain ends on an optimistic note with an overview of success stories for black people in politics, media and sport. Leading lights of Anglo-African culture, including Valerie Amos, Lenny Henry and Soul II Soul's Jazzie B, analyse how the country's mood has changed over the past 60 years from hostility to acceptance

programme.title: Black Firsts
programme.desc: Clive Lloyd, former West Indies cricket captain, looks at the life of Learie Constantine, the Trinidad-born cricketer who fought against injustice and discrimination

programme.title: Black Firsts
programme.desc: Jamaican-born Carlton Duncan, who arrived in Britain in 1961 and achieved fame in the dance world before embarking on a teaching career, finally becoming the UK's first black secondary school headmaster in 1982

programme.title: Black Firsts
programme.desc: A profile of Brenda Edwards, who won a place at the London School of Contemporary Dance at 17 and became artistic director of London Festival Ballet. She later returned to her contemporary roots, becoming a teacher and choreographer

programme.desc: Laa-Laa has fun counting to three: 1, 2, 3 rabbits, 1, 2, 3 flowers and 1, 2, 3 trees! Laa-Laa even counts three Teletubbies: Tinky Winky, Dipsy and Po

programme.title: The Baby Club
programme.desc: Babies and their grown-ups play with ribbons and enjoy songs and story time together.

programme.title: What's in Your Bag?
programme.desc: We explore the tendon hammer. Dr Emeka shows us how this terrific tool is used to check that our body’s reflexes are working as they should be

programme.title: Roots and Fruits
programme.desc: Live from the Roots and Fruits theatre, it’s the rhyming queen Artichoke performing her lovely song I’m a Little Artichoke with a little help from Chicory.

programme.title: Vegesaurs
programme.desc: Ginger teaches the baby Pea-Rexes a new survival skill through a game of hide-and-seek.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: In a game of Work, Bluey and Bingo are the latest hires at Dad's drainpipe factory.

programme.title: Love Monster
programme.desc: The hairy hero tries to get his hot chocolate flower seeds to grow with water, music, warmth and light, but nothing happens

programme.title: Love Monster
programme.desc: The hairy hero organises a treasure hunt for his friends, but he is worried that his homemade cookies aren't a special enough treasure

programme.title: School of Roars
programme.desc: The class write letters to one another, but chaos descends when they get delivered to the wrong monsters! Can Wingston solve the post-box puzzle?

programme.title: My Petsaurus
programme.desc: Chloe wants to take a picture of herself with Topsy, but he just won't stay still.

programme.title: Olga Da Polga
programme.desc: Tempted by Fangio the hedgehog and his tales, Olga explores life outside the garden. But after her adventures, she soon finds life at home with Karen is far better!

programme.title: Get Well Soon
programme.desc: Petal finds out why she has to keep going to the toilet as Dr Ranj and Nurse Morag offer information about urine infections in children

programme.title: My World Kitchen
programme.desc: Febo's family are from America, where they celebrate Thanksgiving. As it is traditional on Thanksgiving to prepare and serve pumpkin pie as a dessert, Febo is making this for his friends. He starts by making a pastry case and fitting it into a pie dish. For the pumpkin filling: he pours melted butter and buttermilk into a bowl of brown sugar, along with whisked egg, cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg, allspice and cloves. Febo adds his special ingredient, pumpkin puree, and then mixes them all together. When it's mixed, he spoons it into the empty pastry case and puts it in the oven to cook. Febo's friends all help to decorate his American-themed table before they taste his pumpkin pie.

programme.title: Maddie's Do You Know?
programme.desc: Maddie learns why things float and discovers how sand on a beach is made.

programme.title: Waffle the Wonder Dog
programme.desc: It's the hottest day of the year and Waffle is eating ice cream to cool down. Outside in the sweltering heat, Simon turns on the sprinkler to help everyone cool down, but poor Waffle doesn't like the sprinkler and darts through the hole in the fence to Mrs Hobbs's garden, looking for shade. The Brooklyn-Bells try to coax him back, but he refuses to return. Doug decides to make a mini swimming pool by filling the ball pit with cool water. Waffle loves swimming pools. Maybe that will encourage him back?

programme.title: Woolly & Tig
programme.desc: Tig is given a bicycle for her birthday, but will not take advice from her mother on how to ride it

programme.title: Andy's Aquatic Adventures
programme.desc: CBeebies presenter Andy is jetting off all over the world and meeting amazing animals living in and nearby water. Get ready to explore oceans, rivers and lakes

programme.title: Yakka Dee!
programme.desc: Dee encourages a friend to say 'dragon', and we go on a whirlwind word adventure

programme.title: Numberblocks
programme.desc: Things get out of hand at a Square Club meeting

programme.title: Alphablocks
programme.desc: P, E and N take on a pen that can draw anything it wants to escape from them

programme.title: Dog Loves Books
programme.desc: Dog and Pug meet Little Red Riding Hood and the Big Bad Wolf.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The dog decides to make an omelette, but there are no eggs in the basket, so he tries to find out where all the chickens are

programme.title: Love Monster
programme.desc: The hairy hero is really struggling to choose the perfect epic birthday present at the Everything But Sprinkles store for Bad Idea Puppy. In the end, he goes with his heart

programme.title: Colourblocks
programme.desc: Black joins the Printing Crew. Learn how yellow, cyan, magenta and black work together in printing with the Colourblocks.

programme.title: Something Special
programme.desc: Mr Tumble is having trouble finding his trampoline in the garden, whilst Justin and his friends have lots of fun at an indoor adventure park.

programme.desc: Evil Pea and Supertato face each other in a dance-off

programme.desc: The Go Jetters are in Egypt discovering some amazing Ancient Egyptian artefacts. Soon they discover that the Great Sphinx has been buried - and they guess that Glitch is to blame

programme.title: Teeny Tiny Creatures
programme.desc: Rory and Sandy are in the garden looking for hedgehogs. Chantelle meets two hedgehog rescuers

programme.title: Grace's Amazing Machines
programme.desc: In this episode, CBeebies’ very own motorcycle rider, Grace, shows off three amazing machines that work in docks! Grace helps use a huge mobile harbour crane, shows off the amazing tandem lifting crane and then drives a reach stacker!

programme.title: Swashbuckle
programme.desc: Captain Captain is surprised to find Cook and Line on their best behaviour, after they become tired of losing games, and decide to be good, like the Swashbucklers

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Happy decides to eat a cake they have found in a field, but they are unsure who its real owner is

programme.title: Peter Rabbit

programme.title: Octonauts

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Bluey, Bingo and Dad always take out the bins

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Bingo is desperate to show off her handstand skills

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Evil Pea asks for flying lessons when Broccoli flies her paper plane into her freezer. Evil Pea doesn’t let Broccoli know that she intends to fly high to take over Tato Tower

programme.title: Go Jetters
programme.desc: Grandmaster Glitch is invited to Djenne in Mali, Africa, to visit the people and to see one of his favourite things at work - mud. He is especially impressed by the spectacular Great Mosque of Djenne - the largest structure made from mud in the world

programme.title: Molly and Mack
programme.desc: Caitlin wants to make Daisy and Mack’s anniversary perfect. When the other kids are roped in to help, the second first date doesn’t go quite as Caitlin imagined.

programme.title: Waffle the Wonder Dog
programme.desc: Evie and Doug enjoy their first playdate together with their friends. They try out their new ball pit, but Waffle cannot join in because he's not toilet trained and he has to find fun elsewhere

programme.title: Sarah & Duck
programme.desc: When Bread Man needs help, Sarah and Duck come to the rescue with their tandem bike

programme.title: JoJo & Gran Gran
programme.desc: JoJo and Gran Gran are having a spring clear out, but when Gran Gran wants to clear out her old jumper, JoJo is distraught - she loves that snuggly jumper!

programme.title: Moon and Me
programme.desc: In the Toy House Colly Wobble is looking in the mirror, trying out her funny walk

programme.title: Clangers
programme.desc: A meteor shower of gemstones falls on the planet. Baby Soup Dragon beats Tiny and Small in a game to win them. The others continue the game without him and his stones, he realises that there is more fun to be had in playing than just winning

programme.title: Live Challenge Cup Rugby League
programme.desc: Wigan Warriors v Warrington Wolves (Kick-off 2.30pm). All the action from the quarter-final at DW Stadium. The Warriors are the holders and have been among the outstanding teams in the Super League so far this season, but the Wolves have also impressed in the league and will have high hopes of emulating their last triumph in this competition four years ago if they can negotiate this difficult tie

programme.title: Wynne's Welsh 70s
programme.desc: Alongside his dog Ginny, the celebrated tenor and broadcaster mines BBC Wales's archives of 1976 to present some of that year's TV gold. Featuring memories of one of the hottest summers on record, and clips of a woman called Gert revealing her secrets to a good chimney sweep and Wales winning the Triple Crown. Wynne also shares film of his holidays with his grandma at Pendine sands

programme.title: Weatherman Walking
programme.desc: Derek Brockway follows the Heart of Wales Railway in Carmarthenshire and takes part in the World Bog Snorkelling Championships. He also takes part in a tug-of-war with young farmers and has afternoon tea under a railway viaduct. Matthew Bassett joins cyclists in Llandovery and wildlife expert Lizzie Daly goes in search of pied flycatchers in rare Atlantic oak woodland

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: In an episode celebrating the 50th anniversary of the Welsh Surfing Federation, John Craven meets Linda Sharp, the UK's first female European champion who helped shape e Welsh surfing culture in the 1970s. He also joins Swansea's Surfers Against Sewage at one of their monthly beach cleans. Margherita Taylor discovers the magical landscape of the Kenfig sand dune system, Joe Crowley explores how nature could be threatened by the UK's growing demand for water, and Adam Henson catches up with young farmers

programme.title: Spy in the Ocean
programme.desc: Extraordinary relationships among the creatures of the ocean, from spider crabs watching each other's backs for predators while they shed their shells, to fish cleaning the skins and teeth of hammerhead sharks. Off the coast of Costa Rica, a team of spy cameras capture a megapod of spinner dolphins, numbering in their thousands, working together to drive the flying fish from below while tuna and frigate birds pursue them in the air

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Sefton Park in Liverpool, where treasures include cufflinks made from 2,000-year-old coins, a letter from Kate Bush to one of her fans, a portrait from the English Civil War and an early version of the Beatles logo made for a drumkit. Fiona meets the descendent of a local hero, James Clarke, who moved to the city from Guyana at the turn of the 20th century and used his swimming skills to save countless lives in Liverpool's docks

programme.title: Ten Pound Poms
programme.desc: Annie is compelled to make a stand for migrants and stages a peaceful protest, but things get quickly out of hand and Pattie is badly hurt. Kate returns amidst the carnage to find a surprise visitor waiting and Sheila's desperation spirals

programme.title: Legends of Welsh Sport
programme.desc: A nostalgic film celebrating the remarkable career of the Welsh football legend John Toshack, from seven seasons at the top as a player at Liverpool, to success as a manager with the likes of Real Sociedad, Real Madrid and Wales

programme.title: In the Heart of the Sea (2015)
programme.desc: A whaling ship sets sail from New England in 1820, only to come under attack from a gigantic whale that seems to want revenge on them. In the aftermath of the attack, the surviving members of the crew face further physical and moral challenges as they try to stay alive on the open sea. Fact-based historical adventure, starring Chris Hemsworth, Cillian Murphy and Ben Whishaw

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Claimed and Shamed
programme.desc: A young woman who tried to cover up a car crash calls up to confess, and the party's over for a wedding guest who lost £26,000 of bling on the dancefloor

programme.title: Dirty Rotten Scammers
programme.desc: Mother and daughter Mavis and Michelle Ackerley introduce stories of digital crime. Sally's inheritance was lost to scammers when they hacked into her solicitor's email account. Kent Police tell the story of disgruntled employee turned hacker who threatened 150 jobs

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: The progress of properties in East Suffolk, South Yorkshire and Cambridgeshire. Jacqui Joseph heads to Lowestoft to see a one bed flat that's just a stone's throw from the beach. Dion Dublin is in Mexborough to visit a two-bed end-of-terrace in need of a full refurbishment. Tommy Walsh is in Whittlesey casting his eye over a three-bedroom detached house that is seriously lacking in kerb appeal

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles presents the show from Leominster and learns about the heritage of one of the town's oldest timber buildings. Kate Bliss and Philip Serrell assist the teams

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Nina gives Rosie a task, Zara tries to deal with Miles, and Kirsty goes on her first VPAS visit, and helps a broken family

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph explores Beaconsfield recycling centre in Buckinghamshire, selecting a pair of worn-down wicker chairs, an old coal scuttle and a pair of bedside tables

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson explores the countryside of North and West Yorkshire with a couple from West Sussex, who want a home with a big workshop for woodworking

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and Lee Burkhill come up with plans to transform an overgrown garden in Southampton into a tropical paradise perfect for friends and family to relax in

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: Single dad Martin calls on the team to give his daughter a multi-purpose bedroom. With just 24 hours and a limited budget, they construct an art desk with clever storage

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong hosts the quiz in which contestants try to record the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Lauren Laverne reveals the correct answers and comments on the players' scores
