programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Jermaine Jenas present the first visit of the week to the One Show studio, featuring the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Elaine hosts a Battle of the Dads karaoke competition at the Vic and Vinny threatens Eve. Ben and Jay try to connect with Lexi but they clash over the idea of her speaking at Lola's funeral. Lily and Ricky meet with social services

programme.title: Weatherman Walking
programme.desc: Derek Brockway visits Rhondda Cynon Taf for a seven-mile circular trail that starts and ends in Hirwaun. On his route, he learns about the area's industrial past, visits a whisky distillery and takes a ride on the world's fastest seated zipline. Meanwhile, wildlife expert Lizzie Daly investigates how otters are under threat and Onkar Singh Purewal goes on a trek with alpacas across the Brecon Beacons

programme.title: Full House
programme.desc: Regular faces Tina, Debbie and their team of super scrubbers are back in the hall with more top cleaning tips and Tina has a special question to ask her partner of 16 years - a question that requires a bended knee. The staff also have a special treat in store for Sylvia, one of their most loyal customers over the years, who is about to celebrate a big birthday. Meanwhile, drag queen Dominic has a surprise for his best mate and aspiring drag queen Tom

programme.title: Best Interests
programme.desc: Nicci's campaign becomes national news, but she has cause to hesitate when she discovers she will have to make Samantha appear to be incompetent as a doctor. Katie has an argument with Hannah that leads in turn to a confrontation between her and her mother. Andrew realises there may no longer a place for him at his daughter's bedside

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Match of the Day Wales
programme.desc: Turkiye v Wales. Catrin Heledd presents action from the UEFA Euro 2024 Group D qualifier, which took place at Canik 19 May Stadium

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Around one in seven in the UK now takes an antidepressant. Globally they have made the pharmaceutical industry billions. When the current generation of drugs was launched 35 years ago, they promised a safe and effective treatment, free from the side effects of older medicines. But have they lived up to those claims? Whilst many people say they have benefited from taking them, Panorama reveals evidence of some companies trying to conceal concerns about their drugs and follows patients who've suffered serious side effects as they continue their fight to be heard

The Warriors are the holders and have been among the outstanding teams in the Super League so far this season, but the Wolves have also impressed in the league and will have high hopes of emulating their last triumph in this competition four years ago if they can negotiate this difficult tie

programme.title: Spy in the Ocean
programme.desc: Disguised underwater cameras capture displays of emotion from sea creatures, including dolphins getting an adrenaline rush from jumping, leaping and playing tricks in the waves. Spy cameras also capture displays of affection among manatees and cuttlefish courtship, as well as the mimic octopus passing itself off as other creatures to avoid predators

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: In an episode celebrating the 50th anniversary of the Welsh Surfing Federation, John Craven meets Linda Sharp, the UK's first female European champion who helped shape e Welsh surfing culture in the 1970s. He also joins Swansea's Surfers Against Sewage at one of their monthly beach cleans. Margherita Taylor discovers the magical landscape of the Kenfig sand dune system, Joe Crowley explores how nature could be threatened by the UK's growing demand for water, and Adam Henson catches up with young farmers

programme.title: Spy in the Ocean
programme.desc: Extraordinary relationships among the creatures of the ocean, from spider crabs watching each other's backs for predators while they shed their shells, to fish cleaning the skins and teeth of hammerhead sharks. Off the coast of Costa Rica, a team of spy cameras capture a megapod of spinner dolphins, numbering in their thousands, working together to drive the flying fish from below while tuna and frigate birds pursue them in the air

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Sefton Park in Liverpool, where treasures include cufflinks made from 2,000-year-old coins, a letter from Kate Bush to one of her fans, a portrait from the English Civil War and an early version of the Beatles logo made for a drumkit. Fiona meets the descendent of a local hero, James Clarke, who moved to the city from Guyana at the turn of the 20th century and used his swimming skills to save countless lives in Liverpool's docks

programme.title: Ten Pound Poms
programme.desc: Annie is compelled to make a stand for migrants and stages a peaceful protest, but things get quickly out of hand and Pattie is badly hurt. Kate returns amidst the carnage to find a surprise visitor waiting and Sheila's desperation spirals

programme.title: In the Heart of the Sea (2015)
programme.desc: A whaling ship sets sail from New England in 1820, only to come under attack from a gigantic whale that seems to want revenge on them. In the aftermath of the attack, the surviving members of the crew face further physical and moral challenges as they try to stay alive on the open sea. Fact-based historical adventure, starring Chris Hemsworth, Cillian Murphy and Ben Whishaw

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Claimed and Shamed
programme.desc: A young woman who tried to cover up a car crash calls up to confess, and the party's over for a wedding guest who lost £26,000 of bling on the dancefloor

programme.title: Dirty Rotten Scammers
programme.desc: Mother and daughter Mavis and Michelle Ackerley introduce stories of digital crime. Sally's inheritance was lost to scammers when they hacked into her solicitor's email account. Kent Police tell the story of disgruntled employee turned hacker who threatened 150 jobs

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: The progress of properties in East Suffolk, South Yorkshire and Cambridgeshire. Jacqui Joseph heads to Lowestoft to see a one bed flat that's just a stone's throw from the beach. Dion Dublin is in Mexborough to visit a two-bed end-of-terrace in need of a full refurbishment. Tommy Walsh is in Whittlesey casting his eye over a three-bedroom detached house that is seriously lacking in kerb appeal

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles presents the show from Leominster and learns about the heritage of one of the town's oldest timber buildings. Kate Bliss and Philip Serrell assist the teams

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Nina gives Rosie a task, Zara tries to deal with Miles, and Kirsty goes on her first VPAS visit, and helps a broken family

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph explores Beaconsfield recycling centre in Buckinghamshire, selecting a pair of worn-down wicker chairs, an old coal scuttle and a pair of bedside tables

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson explores the countryside of North and West Yorkshire with a couple from West Sussex, who want a home with a big workshop for woodworking

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and Lee Burkhill come up with plans to transform an overgrown garden in Southampton into a tropical paradise perfect for friends and family to relax in

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: Single dad Martin calls on the team to give his daughter a multi-purpose bedroom. With just 24 hours and a limited budget, they construct an art desk with clever storage

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong hosts the quiz in which contestants try to record the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Lauren Laverne reveals the correct answers and comments on the players' scores

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Jermaine Jenas present the first visit of the week to the One Show studio, featuring the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Elaine hosts a Battle of the Dads karaoke competition at the Vic and Vinny threatens Eve. Ben and Jay try to connect with Lexi but they clash over the idea of her speaking at Lola's funeral. Lily and Ricky meet with social services

programme.title: Disclosure
programme.desc: Samantha Poling investigates the companies that deal in debt. With the cost of living crisis hitting hard, more and more people are struggling to pay what they owe. She lifts the lid on the multi-million pound trade in debt management and reveals the often unscrupulous tactics being used by predatory businesses to target the vulnerable

programme.title: Scotland's Home of the Year
programme.desc: Judges Anna Campbell Jones, Banjo Beale and Michael Angus visit three would-be finalists from the West. The properties featured are an Edwardian renovation in Glasgow's West End which was originally three separate townhouses, a 1950s extended property in Kirkintilloch with colourful interiors, and a converted Victorian villa in Greenock

programme.title: Best Interests
programme.desc: Nicci's campaign becomes national news, but she has cause to hesitate when she discovers she will have to make Samantha appear to be incompetent as a doctor. Katie has an argument with Hannah that leads in turn to a confrontation between her and her mother. Andrew realises there may no longer a place for him at his daughter's bedside

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Around one in seven in the UK now takes an antidepressant. Globally they have made the pharmaceutical industry billions. When the current generation of drugs was launched 35 years ago, they promised a safe and effective treatment, free from the side effects of older medicines. But have they lived up to those claims? Whilst many people say they have benefited from taking them, Panorama reveals evidence of some companies trying to conceal concerns about their drugs and follows patients who've suffered serious side effects as they continue their fight to be heard

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Clive Myrie hosts, with actor Munya Chawawa and journalist Helen Lewis joining team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop as they delve into the news

programme.title: Glow Up: Britain's Next Make-Up Star
programme.desc: The semi-finalists are tasked with getting celebrities red carpet ready at the Brit Awards under the watchful eye of MUA to the stars, Hector Espinal. At Glow Up Studios, the artists draw upon their university projects to wow the judges and secure their spot in the final. In the Face Off elimination, the bottom two are asked to produce a spider lash

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Anna Haugh is joined by chefs Chantelle Nicholson and Theo Randall, plus special guest Stacey Dooley. Olly Smith picks the wines to go with the studio dishes

programme.title: Trooping the Colour: The King's Birthday Parade
programme.desc: Huw Edwards introduces live coverage of King Charles III's first official birthday parade. From the heart of London, the Welsh Guards troop their colour on Horse Guards Parade in a world-renowned spectacle full of music, majesty and military precision. The morning's events culminate with the annual RAF fly-past and the royal family's iconic balcony appearance. JJ Chalmers speaks live to those associated with this remarkable day

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles is at the helm with experts Danny Sebastian and Caroline Hawley, as two teams scour the antiques centre in the hope that they can make the greater profit at auction. There are plenty of highs and lows in the saleroom, while Eric also gets the chance to meet an unlikely war hero

programme.title: Live Challenge Cup Rugby League
programme.desc: Hull FC v St Helens (Kick-off 2.30pm). All the action from the quarter-final at MKM Stadium. Hull have struggled for consistency in the Super League this season, but claimed a convincing 32-8 victory away to Castleford Tigers in the previous round. The Saints won 26-6 at Championship side Halifax Panthers last time out and have also been below their best at times so far this term

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie and the Rich brother's face one of their hardest ever garden rescues to date in Stowmarket, turning a concrete space into a family friendly back garden

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: The Hit List
programme.desc: Marvin and Rochelle Humes present a celebrity edition of the music-based quiz show. Food critic Jay Rayner and baker John Whaite, Steps stars Faye Tozer and Ian 'H' Watkins, and comedians Jayde Adams and Babatunde Aléshé must name as many hit songs and artists as possible, with a £10,000 jackpot for their chosen charity up for grabs

programme.title: Michael McIntyre's The Wheel
programme.desc: The comedian hosts the Saturday-night gameshow, in which contestants take on a colossal spinning wheel and answer questions in the hope of securing a cash prize. Tonight's expert celebrity advice comes from Chris Moyles on breakfast radio, Clare Balding on Wimbledon, Josh Widdicombe on Neighbours, Yung Filly on YouTube, Frankie Bridge on girl groups, Owain Wyn Evans on weather and Rustie Lee on food

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman present a star-studded version of the general knowledge quiz. Stephen Bailey, Janine Harouni, Tony Way, Ethan Lawrence, Priya Davdra, Kimberly Hart-Simpson, Nabil Abdul Rashid and Felicity Ward try to come up with the least likely correct answers to a series of questions posed to members of the public

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Jan's actions have a disastrous impact on her personal life as she and Iain deal with a road accident involving a vehicle transporting a heart for an urgent transplant. Jodie takes Max's advice following a hard day, possibly against her better judgement, and Jacob becomes insecure when Sah comments on his age

programme.title: Annika
programme.desc: The DI and her team are tasked with solving the murder of a man who was thrown in the river from a party boat - an investigation made all the more difficult by the fact that everyone supposedly loved the victim

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather

programme.title: Annika
programme.desc: A young woman murdered on the Glasgow docks hits the officers hard when Michael's brother is named as the next of kin. As the team investigates, Michael is taken off the case

programme.title: The Deer Hunter (1978)
programme.desc: The lives of three American steelworkers and their families are torn apart in the wake of the Vietnam War. After enduring horrific treatment in a prison camp during the conflict, the three friends return to their homes but struggle to readjust to normal life. Oscar-winning drama, starring Robert De Niro, Christopher Walken, Meryl Streep, John Savage and John Cazale in his last film role

programme.title: Alba Today
programme.desc: BBC Alba joins Radio nan Gàidheal, the BBC's Gaelic language radio service

programme.title: AH-AH/No-No
programme.desc: AH-AH thinks that it would be great to have wheels on his bed so that he could have a nap and go wherever he wanted, in his own time. However, everybody else wants to race

programme.title: Treubh an Tuathanais (Big Barn Farm)
programme.desc: There's much tidying to be carried out on the farm today, in preparation for some very important visitors, and everyone is busy with their preparations

programme.title: Pip & Posy
programme.desc: When Pip and Posy play space mission, they want to do different things. However they miss one another so much that they need to find a way to play the separate things together

programme.title: Oscar & Ealasaid
programme.desc: Augustin invites Célestine over to celebrate his birthday

programme.title: Sionnach agus Maigheach (Fox & Hare)
programme.desc: Fox finds a giant dice in a box of discarded belongings. Owl really likes it too and decides to trade it for his favourite doll, Oehoe

programme.title: Aithne air Ainmhidhean (All About Animals)
programme.desc: Following the activities of Chiku, a 12-week-old cheetah who lives in the Masai Mara Reserve in Kenya and who has just discovered how to hide using her spots as camouflage

programme.title: Kung Fu Panda
programme.desc: Mantis is called back to his home town and Shifu insists that Po accompany him on his journey. However, Mantis does not want any company - as he's told everyone in his village that he is the Dragon Warrior

programme.title: An Là (News)
programme.desc: Local, national and international news and information from BBC Alba

programme.title: Am BFG (The BFG) (1989)
programme.desc: A friendly giant befriends a lonely little girl and transports her to a strange land. Unfortunately, a number of the other giants there have acquired a taste for eating children. Determined to stop their nefarious habit, the pair set out to charm the Queen of England into putting her armed forces at their disposal. Animated adventure, based on Roald Dahl's classic tale, with the voices of Donald Smith, Catriona Lexy Campbell and Donna Morrison

programme.title: Prosbaig
programme.desc: Donald Morrison looks back at more 1980s BBC reports, including how Margaret Thatcher's housing policies affected the Highlands and the computerisation of the Gaelic Bible

programme.title: Leugh Mi (Book Show)
programme.desc: Anna Macleod talks to Domhnall Ruadh Smith and Charles Wilson, who both discuss books of special interest to them. Among the selection are the story of an historical science group, Aboriginal culture and a Welsh folklore epic

programme.title: Eilean Mo Ghaoil (From Lewis with Love)
programme.desc: Peigi Ann is busy with lambing, the west side football team are on home ground for an important game and Mairi and Tom take home the peats

programme.title: Cuirm@Celtic

programme.desc: Amy and Jonah help Mateo's toy drive in an attempt to make him look good ahead of his immigration hearing, and Jerry and Sandra ask Glenn to officiate their wedding

Starring John Thaw and Kevin Whately, with Joanna David, Samantha Bond, David Haig, Adrian Dunbar and James Grout

programme.desc: British forces in colonial India find themselves in deep trouble when a manic local ruler discovers the soldiers' fearsome reputation is thoroughly undeserved - prompting open rebellion. Comedy, starring Sid James, Kenneth Williams, Charles Hawtrey, Roy Castle, Joan Sims, Bernard Bresslaw and Terry Scott

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The sleuth finds himself in interesting company as English socialites and American millionaires rub shoulders on board a train bound for the French Riviera. Passengers include oil magnate Rufus Van Aldin (Elliott Gould) and his daughter Ruth (Jaime Murray) - to whom he has given a magnificent ruby known as the Heart of Fire. With members of the aristocracy crammed into a confined space with their husbands, lovers and a renowned gemstone, murder cannot be far away. With Lindsay Duncan, Roger Lloyd Pack and James D'Arcy

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: Richard Abernethie is found dead shortly after disinheriting his sole heir and specifying that his legacy is to be divided equally among the remaining family members. Poirot is called in by his solicitor friend Gilbert Entwhistle, to ascertain whether the late Mr Abernethie met with foul play - and also finds time to investigate the murder of a beneficiary under the new terms of the will. Whodunit, starring David Suchet, with Robert Bathurst, Anna Calder-Marshall and Geraldine James

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: Crime writer Ariadne Oliver (My Family's Zoe Wanamaker) and four known killers are among those who meet Poirot at a bridge evening arranged by wealthy adventurer Shaitana, who sits out the first game - only to be found later stabbed through the heart. As nobody has left or entered the victim's apartment during the night, the guests combine their skills to discover which of the party is responsible. Whodunit, starring David Suchet, with Lesley Manville and Alex Jennings

programme.title: Foyle's War
programme.desc: As Foyle prepares to be replaced at the police station and begin retirement, his attention is grabbed by a news story about a man sentenced to hang for high treason, and he decides to take on the case. But with the prisoner's execution date approaching, the detective has to work fast to find evidence that will clear him. Meanwhile, Samantha and Adam fight to save Hill House from the town planners determined to demolish it - but disaster soon strikes. Starring Michael Kitchen, Honeysuckle Weeks and Max Brown

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a woman is drowned in a bath and made to look like a bride, with a chilling lipstick message on the bathroom mirror, it triggers a spate of ghoulish wedding-themed murders in Great Worthy. The case takes Barnaby and Jones to a donkey sanctuary, a heritage steam railway and a pub run by an ex-policeman and former brothel madam as they try to identify the killer. Guest starring Pam Ferris (Rosemary & Thyme) and Kacey Ainsworth (formerly EastEnders' Little Mo)

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Bullard asks Barnaby to investigate the disappearance of a friend's daughter who was a member of the Oblong Foundation, a cult based at Malham Hall. Jones goes under cover as a new recruit to solve the mystery, but he and Barnaby soon start digging into an old case involving the death of a couple in a boat explosion, which could be linked to the missing woman. Detective drama, starring Neil Dudgeon and Jason Hughes, with Will Knightley, Kevin Doyle, Holly Aird, Barbara Flynn and John Woodvine

programme.title: Van Der Valk
programme.desc: The detective and his team investigate when a classical musician and former musical child prodigy dies after being the victim of an acid attack, asking if the intention was to maim and disfigure, or to kill. As the incident took place in a crowded concert hall foyer with numerous witnesses, was the attacker trying to send a message?

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Dorothy becomes concerned her grand-daughter Taisie is being influenced by Rachel, while Janet is mortified when Gill berates her for inappropriate behaviour toward young sergeant Rob. The detective duo are sent to investigate the death of a man in a nursing home after his daughter complains about the level of care he had been receiving. Will they find any evidence of foul play? Detective drama, starring Lesley Sharp, Suranne Jones and Danny Miller

programme.desc: Part two of two. Nick's attempted suicide implicates him in Emma's death and Annabel casts light on the mystery. Drama, with James d'Arcy and Abigail Cruttenden

Brian Cox guest stars, with John Thaw and Kevin Whately

Bawdy comedy, starring Sid James, Bernard Bresslaw, Kenneth Williams, Joan Sims and Barbara Windsor

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: A gathering at the Devon estate of Miss Marple's old school friend Lady Tressilian leads to murder when the eccentric Mr Treves tells the story of an unconvicted child killer. Miss Marple is on hand to assist Supt Mallard of the local constabulary, but not before a second victim is claimed. Mystery, starring Geraldine McEwan, with guest appearances by Eileen Atkins, Tom Baker, Paul Nicholls, Alan Davies and Greg Wise, with a cameo by former British number-one tennis player Greg Rusedski

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: Horticultural lecturer Rosemary Boxer is hired by a wealthy but ill businessman to help cure a disease causing his trees to lose their bark. She gets to know Laura Thyme, who turns up after a friend is killed in a suspicious car accident, and when the pair find the lord of the manor unconscious beneath his bedroom window, they must decide whether depression led him to attempt suicide or if there is a more sinister explanation. Drama, starring Felicity Kendal, Pam Ferris, David Mallinson and Roger Alborough

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The amateur sleuths uncover the remains of a racehorse while engaged on horticultural work in the grounds of pop star Nev Connolly's supposedly haunted mansion. Before long, gruesome revelations are coming thick and fast as Nev is shot dead and more bones are discovered - this time belonging to a young woman. As they investigate further, Rosemary and Laura are plunged into a sinister mystery with roots deep in the past. Drama, guest starring Murray Head (Heartbeat) and Abigail Cruttenden (Benidorm)

programme.title: Long Lost Family: Born Without Trace
programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell present the stories of people who were abandoned as babies, helping them try to find their birth families and know their identities. David McBride was left in a car as a two-week-old infant in January 1962, while Helen Ward was left in a tartan bag in a telephone box in Dundalk in 1968

programme.title: The Savoy
programme.desc: Cameras return to follow life inside the glamorous London hotel as it finally reopens its doors after being forced to close during the pandemic. Doorman Tony is emotional to be welcoming old friends back, while Sean and Michael look after guests staying in the new £16,000 per night Royal Suite by Gucci, and chef Gordon Ramsay opens a new restaurant

programme.title: Foyle's War
programme.desc: It's 1946 and although one war has ended, another is looming as the Iron Curtain falls across Europe. Foyle arrives home from America, where he is wanted in connection with a suspicious suicide, but MI5 offers him a way out. The agency suspects Britain's atomic research programme has been infiltrated and wants to recruit him to investigate a Soviet spy ring that could be at work in the heart of London. Detective drama, starring Michael Kitchen, with Honeysuckle Weeks, Ellie Haddington and Dylan Charles

programme.desc: The disgraced Elizabeth returns to Eaton Place with her unwanted child and former nursemaid in tow. Classic period drama, starring Gordon Jackson, Jean Marsh and Simon Williams

programme.desc: With their friendship in tatters, the lack of communication between Rachel and Janet is making even the simplest of tasks difficult, and it takes a call about Gill's possible abduction to reunite them as a team. The duo soon have Gill's car in their sights and identify the kidnapper, but discover they are heading for a notorious suicide location. Can the detectives get to their boss in time?

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: Ever since a beautiful American woman arrived in the peaceful village of Wychwood-under-Ashe, people have begun to die in a series of apparent accidents. Nobody suspects a killer is at work but, as the body count rises, Miss Marple digs a little deeper with the help of a former policeman - and they gradually unearth a secret that will rock the village to its core. Murder mystery, starring Julia McKenzie, Benedict Cumberbatch, David Haig, Sylvia Syms, Margo Stilley and Hugo Speer

programme.desc: A nostalgic Stan remembers his first day at the depot, when he was a conductor and Blakey was a driver. He also recounts the events leading to Arthur and Olive's engagement. Comedy, starring Reg Varney, Stephen Lewis and Michael Robbins

programme.desc: Eric sets out to look for Gloria in London. Jack reports his Land Rover stolen, leaving Andy to explain that Daz has been up to his old tricks. Frances announces she's moving to Hull

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Elaine sees through Robert, while Marlon's nerve begins to fail as Charity's continued presence takes its toll, and Daz lands himself in hot water again after stealing Rodney's car

programme.desc: Fiz finally cracks and tells Toyah about her precious boyfriend's sordid secret. Fred tries to convince Ashley not to go through with the paternity test and as Sarah's 16th birthday arrives, she and Todd excitedly plan a little time to themselves

programme.title: On the Buses
programme.desc: The company mounts an advertising campaign to attract more passengers, and launches a contest to find the perfect bus driver. Reg Varney stars

programme.title: On the Buses

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Dr David Cheriton arrives at St Aidan's Royal Free Hospital in Elsinby, newly qualified and keen to impress at his job interview _ only to discover they aren't even expecting him. Dr Jill Weatherill's professional competence is called into question during a home visit, and hospital porter Ken Hopkirk's efforts to put up a television aerial end in disaster. Julian Ovenden stars

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: A romantic escapade goes horribly wrong for a couple involved in a motorbike accident, and the tragic events of the night leave the staff of St Aiden's struggling to heal more than just a broken heart. Matron investigates when one of Dr Ormerod's patients is uneasy about returning home, while Ken and Alun tackle a plague of rodents threatening to close down the hospital - helped by local rogue Claude Greengrass

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Hippies colonise Lawson's holiday cottages, causing much local dissent and tut-tutting. The only people who don't object to their presence are an undercover journalist in search of a scoop, and Vernon, who is not slow to spot a way of capitalising on the situation. Starring Geoffrey Hughes and Malcolm Tierney

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Christmas is just around the corner, but the last thing Aidensfield's residents feel like doing is over-indulging as a salmonella epidemic grips the village and Dr Summerbee struggles to maintain her goodwill. Meanwhile, Vernon decides the time is right to expand Bernie's funeral empire

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Laurel leads Ashley astray in the Woolpack, but his boozy behaviour doesn't go unnoticed. Daz strives to impress a resentful Andy, and Frances leaves for Hull - will Elaine and Alistair go with her?

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: The bishop gives Ashley a flea in his ear, along with a new housemate. Tricia tries to blot out her feelings of rejection, Marlon considers coming clean and Laurel suffers the pangs of unrequited love

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: A cleaner is found dead in her home and suspicion immediately falls upon her lodger, who is arrested and convicted of her murder. It appears to be an open-and-shut case, but Superintendent Spence begins to question the man's guilt and invites Poirot to help uncover the identity of the real killer. The Belgian sleuth teams up with crime writer Ariadne Oliver (My Family's Zoe Wanamaker) as he tries to crack the case. Whodunit, starring David Suchet, with Richard Hope, Joe Absolom, Amanda Root, Sian Phillips and Raquel Cassidy

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Christmas arrives in Aidensfield, and Mike and Tricia try to reunite a blind woman with her stolen guide dog. Elsewhere, a young woman at the centre of a political scandal seeks refuge in Aidensfield as she attempts to avoid the paparazzi. Jason Durr and Clare Calbraith star

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Blaketon is overjoyed when he discovers a cricketing legend has checked into the pub. David inadvertently prompts a petrol crisis. Nostalgic drama, starring Derek Fowlds, David Lonsdale and Clive Mantle

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: As England and Argentina kick off in the World Cup quarter-final, Oxford's streets are deserted. At an almost empty museum, Adrian Weiss, a specialist in heraldry and genealogy, is found dead - slain by a ceremonial dagger with links to 19th-century India. An entry in the visitors' book leads Morse to a girls' boarding school, where a note reading 'Save Me' is mysteriously slipped into his coat pocket. Digging into the building's troubled history, he finds a connection between Weiss's untimely fate and a series of unsolved murders that occurred on the school's grounds almost 100 years earlier. 1960s-set drama, starring Shaun Evans, with Roger Allam, Anton Lesser, James Bradshaw and Abigail Thaw

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: The evacuation of a central London hospital leads to the discovery of a tragic death. When Brooks and Devlin investigate, a suspect is arrested but the prosecutors (Ben Daniels and Freema Agyeman) face an uphill struggle building a case - so they team up with the detectives in a bid to gather more evidence. Patrick Malahide and Bill Paterson co-star

The return of the crime drama, starring Shaun Dooley, with Katherine Kelly and Jamie Bamber

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: Feature-length drama. Geraldine McEwan stars as the elderly spinster with a nose for a mystery, with guest appearances by Peter Davison, Mica Paris and Francesca Annis

programme.title: Jaws: The Revenge (1987)

But as she is reunited with her surviving son, the predatory fish sets off in pursuit to wipe out the entire family. Thriller sequel, starring Michael Caine, Lorraine Gary, Lance Guest and Mario Van Peebles

programme.title: Mad Max Beyond Thunderdome (1985)
programme.desc: The nomadic warrior pitches up in the city of a cut-throat desert community in search of his stolen vehicle and ends up making a deal with a local dictator to get rid of her rival for power. However, when the bargain turns sour, he is cast out into the wilderness - where he becomes the unlikely protector of a tribe of feral youngsters. Sci-fi adventure sequel, starring Mel Gibson, Tina Turner and Bruce Spence

programme.title: The War Wagon (1967)

Western, starring John Wayne, Kirk Douglas, Bruce Cabot and Howard Keel

programme.title: Live British Touring Car Championship
programme.desc: Further coverage of the fifth meeting of the season from Oulton Park, featuring the 14th and 15th races of the campaign. Three-time champion Ash Sutton is threatening to run away with this year's competition after claiming his fifth and sixth race wins last time out at Thruxton. Presented by Steve Rider with commentary from David Addison, Tim Harvey, Richard John Neil and Paul O'Neill, and reports by Louise Goodman

programme.title: World of Sport
programme.desc: Richard Henwood takes a look back at The Indoor League. A show featuring 1970s pub games, presented by Yorkshire cricketing great Fred Trueman.

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: Extreme angler Jeremy Wade heads to Russia's remote Amur River, where the mysterious deaths of three men appear to be linked to a freshwater giant - a beast that can exceed 18ft in length and weigh more than a ton. However, he encounters a wall of silence and begins to suspect he has stumbled on to a dark secret that isn't supposed to be uncovered

programme.title: Monster Carp
programme.desc: The lads travel to Spain and head off the beaten track to visit Lake Orellana, which is arguably one of the last untouched wild lakes in Europe

programme.title: The Motorbike Show
programme.desc: Henry Cole rides the Monmouthshire countryside on a new Royal Enfield Super Meteor, setting off from Monmouth to visit local historic sites and new motorbike hangouts along the route. This episode also has a feature on the 75th anniversary of the BSA Bantam, and Allen Millyard helps Henry find a new restoration project in the form of a Suzuki GT 750

programme.title: The 1% Club
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Lee Mack in which the questions have nothing to do with remembering facts, but are all about logic and common sense. A hundred contestants begin every show, but who will make it to the end and answer a question only one per cent of the country can get right - and win up to £100,000?

programme.title: Get Carter (1971)
programme.desc: Racketeer Jack Carter returns to his native Newcastle to attend his brother's funeral and investigate the circumstances surrounding his death. As events unfold, he uncovers troubling connections to drugs, pornography and corruption, and finds himself on a collision-course with a criminal kingpin and his cohorts. Mike Hodges' thriller, starring Michael Caine, Ian Hendry, Britt Ekland, Glynn Edwards and John Osborne

She also takes a walk along the Avenue of the Sphinxes and catches up with an old friend who's using satellite technology to find hundreds of previously undiscovered burial sites

programme.title: Blackbird (2019)

Drama, starring Susan Sarandon, Sam Neill and Kate Winslet

programme.title: First Man (2018)

Director Damien Chazelle's Oscar-winning drama based on the book by James R Hansen, starring Ryan Gosling and Claire Foy

programme.title: Shocking Emergency Calls

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer moves into a camper van parked in the backyard, while Marge retains sole residence of the family home, prompting Bart to take swift action in a bid to reunite them. programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Marge tries to bring culture to Springfield by asking architect Frank Gehry (guest starring as himself) to construct a concert hall. However, none of the locals is interested, so Mr Burns decides to turn the disused building into a prison, where Homer soon finds himself confined

Ben embraces Will's Stone Age-style existence in the forest and discovers how a childhood passion carved Will's future, the price he paid for following his dream, and how he is steering it back around as Ben meets him at a new stage in his prehistoric life

programme.title: The Blackouts of '74: When Britain Went Dark
programme.desc: Archive footage and celebrity recollections reveal how 50 years ago during an energy crisis the government imposed a three-day working week for factories, shops and business, and UK-wide household blackouts. Contributors including Billy Brag, Michael Heseltine, Trevor McDonald, Pete Waterman, Diane Jordan and Fern Britton reflect on their own experiences of the blackouts back in 1974

programme.title: Secrets of the Royal Palaces
programme.desc: Kate Williams explores the history of Sandringham in Norfolk, which is one of the few royal residences owned personally by the Windsors. It was purchased in 1861 for the rakish Prince Edward in the hopes he would settle down in the countryside, but instead he turned it into the perfect party palace, with a bowling alley, billiards and endless hunting and shooting. The historian also reveals how Prince Philip once proposed demolishing the place to make way for a more modern replacement, before being forced to relent by the Queen Mother

programme.title: Birds of a Feather: 30 Years of Laughs

programme.title: Noel Edmonds: The Rise & Fall of Mr Saturday Night

programme.desc: Donatello thinks the gang's old-fashioned weapons will not be enough to battle their technologically advanced foes, so builds a robot turtle

programme.title: Cash in the Attic

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Dog handler Steve and the firearms team are involved in a dramatic doorstep showdown in which a man is alleged to have attacked someone with an axe and a machete. A stolen van makes off from officers in Leeds before nearly hitting a dog walker, while a tactical pursuit and containment collars a disqualified driver who tries to pull the wool over the interceptors' eyes

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Bob and BoBo are in pursuit of a clapped-out white van through the back streets, where a dead end brings the vehicle to an abrupt halt and the occupants make off on foot. Martin clocks a driver speeding at more than 100mph, while Kev and rookie Oliver expose a cunning insurance scam

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: A white van fails to stop and leads officers on night-time pursuit round Halifax, but the chase finally comes to an end with devastating consequences. Sophie finds a drunk driver and his girlfriend on a motorway embankment, having abandoned their car, while Clarkie is forced to use pepper spray after a motorist disappears into some bushes

programme.title: Inside the Tower of London
programme.desc: Two baby ravens have joined the Tower's resident colony. One of them, Edgar, is called after the horror writer Edgar Allan Poe, but his sister still needs a name. It will be chosen by public vote and Ravenmaster Chris is on tenterhooks waiting to find out the result. Cameras also focus on Tower Governor Brigadier Andrew Jackson and Chief Yeoman Warder Pete McGowran. They are rehearsing a new ceremony celebrating the Tower re-opening its gates to visitors after the covid lockdown

programme.title: Inside the Tower of London
programme.desc: It is June and staff at the Tower are bringing out the big guns to celebrate the anniversary of Elizabeth II's coronation in 1953. A massive 62-gun salute is planned on the Wharf, but with his boss, the Chief Yeoman Warder, away, new Yeoman Gaoler Rob Fuller is in charge for the first time. Three 4,000lb guns and thousands of visitors to contend with mean the pressure's on Rob to get it right

programme.title: The Black Death
programme.desc: Dan Snow and archaeologist Raksha Dave investigate how the plague devastated Britain 700 years ago, killing around three million people across the country. In the first edition, Dan heads to Melcombe Regis in Dorset as he traces the spread of the plague and finds out how the disease reached Britain's shores in 1348. At The Old Operating Theatre in London, Raksha witnesses the horrific symptoms of this deadly disease and the terrifying outcome for those who fell victim to it, and also investigates the recent discovery of mass graves beneath a tranquil London square

programme.title: 5 News Weekend
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world

programme.title: Holiday Scams: Don't Get Caught Out
programme.desc: Alexis Conran exposes the tricks and pitfalls of holiday scammers, talking to victims who are thousands of pounds out of pocket and experts who know the scammers' secrets. From the flight scam that makes people think they've booked when they haven't, and families who book villas that don't exist, to the holiday cottage owners who are also getting ripped off, Alexis makes helps potential tourists become more savvy about the scammers

programme.title: Britain's Poshest Farm Shop
programme.desc: Part one of two. Documentary celebrating seven of the finest farm shops in the country, including one in rural Wales whose customers include members of the Royal family. There is also a look at a Lincolnshire farm shop on the historical Doddington Estate

programme.title: Happy Campers: The Caravan Park
programme.desc: At the Tencreek Holiday Park in Looe, Cornwall, housekeeper Pixie and maintenance man Dion have a shock when they encounter a static caravan that's been left in a serious state of disrepair. With new campers already on their way, they face a race against a time to get the sofas repaired and the floors and worktops spotless. At Crealy Theme Park & Resort in Devon, it's one of the busiest check-in days of the summer and newly promoted rides manager Dan is forced to roll up his sleeves and join the housekeeping team to help them prepare the lodges for the new arrivals

programme.title: A Country Life for Half the Price with Kate Humble
programme.desc: Kate revisits Georgie and Robin Monaghan, who traded in their suburban home in Worthing, East Sussex, for a detached house in the village of Shebbear in Devon. The couple had plans to convert the outbuilding into a holiday let and develop an allotment and rear hens to live a more sustainable life, but with work and occasional commuting, plus two young boys to raise, it wasn't going to be without its challenges, especially when they were thrown a very complicated cancer-shaped curve ball

programme.title: The Rise & Fall of John Leslie
programme.desc: Documentary charting the career of the TV presenter, who found himself at the centre of a media storm that began with a simple slip of the tongue and an ensuing series of scandals led to him disappearing from the nation's TV screens

programme.title: Lethal Weapon 2 (1989)
programme.desc: Headstrong cop Martin Riggs and his cautious partner Roger Murtaugh stumble across a plot by a South African diplomat to launder drugs money by shipping gold coins into the US via his embassy. Protected by diplomatic immunity, the crook looks certain to evade the law - while his chief henchman has a connection to Riggs' traumatic past. Action thriller sequel, with Mel Gibson, Danny Glover, Joe Pesci, Joss Ackland, Derrick O'Connor and Patsy Kensit

Mario's injuries are obvious, as his legs have taken the full impact of an explosion from a gas canister and now doctors must open his wounds to remove dozens of dangerous clots before the circulation is severely compromised

programme.title: Police Interceptors

On the M62, Charlie and Wayne are heading to a call when a white van drifts into their path, nearly causing them to crash into the central reservation

programme.title: Teleshopping

programme.title: Traffic Cops

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: Dave and Alex respond to a report of a motorbike theft near Ilkeston and the officers hunt down a pack of suspects in an hour-long chase, which concludes with Derbyshire's first-ever use of a stinger to stop a motorbike. Baby Yusuf arrives for his eight-week checks, and Dr Qamar supports a patient who has been struggling with anxiety

programme.desc: Charlie is determined to catch a large fish, but is in danger of sinking when he damages his boat

programme.title: Thomas & Friends

programme.title: Marmaduke (2010)
programme.desc: An advertising executive tries to start a new life in California with his family and their lumbering, disaster-prone Great Dane. The friendly but clumsy dog accidentally causes chaos for his owners, until an incident at a surfing competition makes him a local celebrity. Comedy, with Lee Pace, and featuring the voice of Owen Wilson

programme.title: A Shot in the Dark (1964)
programme.desc: The bungling Inspector Clouseau is sent to investigate a high-profile murder case. All the clues point to a maid being the guilty party, but the accident-prone detective is instantly smitten with her, and devotes his efforts to proving her innocence - despite all evidence to the contrary. Comedy, starring Peter Sellers, Elke Sommer, George Sanders and Herbert Lom

programme.title: The Chronicles of Narnia: The Voyage of the Dawn Treader (2010)
programme.desc: Lucy and Edmund Pevensie return to the magical world accompanied by their selfish cousin. They join their old friend King Caspian as he sets sail across the sea in search of seven of his father's allies who had been banished years before, but along the way they discover an evil force is growing in strength. Fantasy adventure, with Georgie Henley, Skandar Keynes, Will Poulter and Ben Barnes

programme.title: Jumanji (1995)
programme.desc: A man who has been trapped inside a mysterious jungle board game for 26 years is eventually freed when two children start to play it. Unfortunately, he arrives with a rampaging horde of animals on his heels, leaving only one solution - to finish the game he started all those years ago. Fantasy adventure, starring Robin Williams, Kirsten Dunst and Bonnie Hunt

programme.title: My Spy (2020)
programme.desc: Special Forces operative turned spy JJ undertakes covert surveillance of Kate Newton, the sister-in-law of a terrorist. JJ is ordered to keep a low profile. Unfortunately, Kate's resourceful nine-year-old daughter Sophie blows his cover and blackmails JJ into training her as a spy. Comedy, starring Dave Bautista and Chloe Coleman

programme.title: Angel Has Fallen (2019)
programme.desc: Secret Service agent Mike Banning finds himself framed for an assassination attempt on the President. Pursued by his own agency and the FBI, Banning races to clear his name and uncover the real terrorist threat - which has set its sights on Air Force One. Action thriller sequel, starring Gerard Butler and Morgan Freeman

programme.title: No Looking Back (2021)
programme.desc: When Olga is released from prison after four years, she has one thing on her mind - getting her daughter, Masha back. But Olga's mother, Vera won't give Masha up easily. Comic crime thriller, starring Viktoriya Korotkova and Anna Mikhalkova. In Russian, with English subtitles

programme.title: Blair Witch (2016)
programme.desc: Twenty years have passed since the victims of the Blair Witch disappeared in the woods in Maryland, with James still wondering what happened to his sister Heather. When he discovers eerie Internet footage of someone resembling her, he and three friends set out to investigate, taking along cameras to document their search. Horror sequel, starring James Allen McCune, Callie Hernandez, Brandon Scott, Valorie Curry, Corbin Reid and Wes Robinson

programme.title: Animal Farm (1954)
programme.desc: Animals rebel against their unscrupulous owner and take control of his farm, vowing to run things fairly, with equality for all. However, the pigs leading the revolt succumb to greed and corruption, culminating in violence and oppression. Animated drama based on George Orwell's novel, narrated by Gordon Heath and with Maurice Denham providing the voices for all the characters

programme.title: Lemony Snicket's A Series of Unfortunate Events (2004)
programme.desc: Three orphans are entrusted into the care of their sinister uncle, a master of disguise who intends to kill them for the family fortune. Quickly realising he is up to no good, the children flee, moving from one prospective guardian to the next - but their wily relative is never far behind. Comedy adventure based on the children's books, starring Jim Carrey, Meryl Streep, Jude Law, Liam Aitken and Emily Browning, with Kara and Shelby Hoffman

programme.title: Entrapment (1999)
programme.desc: An elusive professional art thief suspected of stealing a priceless painting is pursued by an insurance agent. However, instead of bringing the criminal to book, she teams up with him to plot the robbery of a lifetime - although neither is sure the other can be trusted. Crime thriller, starring Sean Connery, Catherine Zeta-Jones, Ving Rhames, Will Patton and Maury Chaykin

programme.title: The Day the Earth Stood Still (2008)
programme.desc: An alien arrives on Earth, accompanied by an awesomely powerful robot, on a fateful mission - to decide if the human race deserves to continue - and if not, to wipe it out. The visitor is imprisoned in a military facility, but a scientist helps him escape, hoping to prove that mankind is worth saving. Sci-fi drama remake, starring Keanu Reeves and Jennifer Connelly

programme.title: Risen (2016)
programme.desc: A Roman officer and his assistant are charged with investigating what became of Jesus' body following the crucifixion, as the Roman hierarchy fears stories of a resurrected Messiah may lead to an uprising in Jerusalem. However, what they discover during their search forces them to question everything they believe. Biblical drama, starring Joseph Fiennes and Tom Felton

programme.title: Anna (2019)
programme.desc: A young Russian woman who is the victim of domestic abuse reluctantly accepts an offer from the KGB, and soon becomes one of the world's most feared killers. Action thriller written, produced and directed by Luc Besson, and starring Sasha Luss, Helen Mirren, Luke Evans and Cillian Murphy

programme.title: Night School (2018)
programme.desc: Seventeen years after dropping out of high-school group because he couldn't concentrate during a test, barbecue grill salesman Teddy Walker finds himself unemployed following an accident. In the hope of getting a job at a financial investment firm, he and a band of troublesome adults are forced to attend night classes. Comedy, starring Kevin Hart and Tiffany Haddish

programme.title: Sauvage (2018)
programme.desc: A young gay prostitute who leads a simple repetitive life while longing for love sets off on a journey of discovery, uncertain what the future will bring. Drama, starring Félix Maritaud and Eric Bernard. In French

programme.title: Picnic (1955)
programme.desc: A drifter turns up in a small American town looking for a well-off old friend in the hope of borrowing money. However, he causes nothing but trouble for the locals, seducing both his old pal's fiancee and a local schoolteacher. Drama based on William Inge's Pulitzer Prize-winning play, starring William Holden, Cliff Robertson and Kim Novak

programme.title: El Dorado (1966)
programme.desc: An ageing gunfighter is drawn into the conflict between a land-grabbing cattle baron and a ranching family, but gets wounded in the process. A year later, he returns to town to find the situation has not improved - so along with his sidekick and the drunken town sheriff, he fights to defend the family from its enemies. Western, starring John Wayne, Robert Mitchum, James Caan and Ed Asner

programme.title: Reach for the Sky (1956)
programme.desc: Biopic of Second World War hero Douglas Bader. A plane crash in 1931 cost the aspiring pilot both his legs, but after learning to walk on artificial limbs, he went on to become one of the RAF's most decorated heroes. However, more misfortune was in store when he was shot down over occupied France and taken prisoner. Starring Kenneth More, Muriel Pavlow and Alexander Knox

programme.title: I, Robot (2004)
programme.desc: The inventor of an advanced form of intelligent robot is found dead, and the detective investigating the case is certain that one of the scientist's mechanical creations is responsible - but no one believes his theory because the robots have been programmed to prevent them from harming humans. Sci-fi thriller, inspired by the Isaac Asimov stories, starring Will Smith, Bridget Moynahan and Alan Tudyk

programme.title: Mechanic: Resurrection (2016)
programme.desc: Hitman Arthur Bishop's arch-enemy Crain kidnaps his new girlfriend Gina and blackmails him into committing three assassinations in as many days, while making them look like accidents. Action thriller sequel, starring Jason Statham, Jessica Alba, Sam Hazeldine and Tommy Lee Jones

programme.title: The Killing of Two Lovers (2020)
programme.desc: A man desperately tries to keep his family of six together during a separation from his wife. Writer/director Robert Machoian's drama, starring Clayne Crawford and Sepideh Moafi

programme.title: Days of the Bagnold Summer (2019)
programme.desc: Daniel, a heavy metal-loving teenager, is forced to spend the summer with his boring old mum. Comedy, starring Earl Cave, Monica Dolan, Tamsin Greig and Rob Brydon. The directorial debut of Simon Bird, best known as one of the stars of The Inbetweeners and Friday Night Dinner

programme.title: Rafiki (2018)
programme.desc: Kena and Ziki are the daughters of two men who are political rivals in an upcoming Nairobi election, and when they start dating they have to be careful about keeping the relationship a secret. Romantic drama, starring Samantha Mugatsia and Sheila Munyiva. In Swahili and English

programme.title: Rude(ish) Tube
programme.desc: Comedy clips showcasing amusing internet videos, featuring weddings, space and sci-fi fans

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Mitch and Cam worry about the growing cost of their wedding, so they agree to each sell a prized possession to earn some extra cash. Jay, Gloria and Manny challenge one another to step outside their comfort zones, involving traditional sausages, pickle and Stella's belly, while the Dunphy kids are in a mischievous mood after finding an old answering machine recording of Claire breaking the news that she's pregnant

programme.title: Don't Tell the Bride
programme.desc: Nathan loves music as well as his home town of Stoke-on-Trent. So, when bride-to-be Beccie gives him free rein to plan their wedding, he decides to honour them - and not her - with nuptials based on the rare grooves of Northern Soul. Will this groom be able to deliver a swinging day, or will his bride be swinging wildly at him?

programme.title: Tad the Lost Explorer and the Secret of King Midas (2017)
programme.desc: Awkward explorer Tad Stones must rescue his beloved Sara from a millionaire who is looking for King Midas's necklace. Animated adventure, with the voices of Trevor White and Alex Kelly

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Part one of two. Gordon Ramsay comes to the aid of Mangia Mangia, an Italian restaurant with an identity crisis in Woodland Park, Colorado, where guests have a choice between casual fine-dining service or a pick-up from the drive-through takeaway. Hard-nosed owner Julie finds herself completely at odds with the head chef, forcing her to breaking point

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay concludes his two-part challenge at Mangia Mangia in Woodland Park, Colorado. In order to save the struggling Italian restaurant from disaster, he must persuade harassed owner Julie to co-operate with the head chef, and work his magic on a menu that relies heavily on a microwave

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay is in Redondo Beach, California, for the first of two visits to Zayna Flaming Grill, a Mediterranean restaurant owned and run by aunt and niece Faye and Brenda. Faye believes she has the weight of the entire restaurant on her shoulders, while Brenda feels she isn't treated as an equal in the business. With tensions rising, the food not up to scratch and everyone playing the blame game, the chef is faced with one of the trickiest situations he's ever encountered

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay concludes his visit to Zayna Flaming Grill in Redondo Beach, California, and finds more questions than answers as he tries to save the crisis-ridden restaurant from disaster. While trying to inject some much-needed flavour into the tired Mediterranean menu, the chef also encourages aunt-and-niece duo Faye and Brenda to settle their differences

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The Emmy-winning comedy returns - as do Cameron and Mitchell, who are back from honeymoon and determined to keep the romance alive. Cameron, however, takes it just a little step too far. The Dunphys, meanwhile, have been enjoying a relaxing summer without smart-alec Alex, who is away on a trip - although she threatens to rock the boat after arriving home early - and Gloria shows a different side after arguing with Jay about the lack of effort he puts into his appearance

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Jay and Gloria celebrate their anniversary, but cannot decide on what kind of gift to give each other. Meanwhile, the Dunphys join Alex on her college tour and Phil, Luke and Haley find themselves in a mirrored waiting room with a button and a sign that says 'Do Not Push'. Comedy, starring Ed O'Neill and Julie Bowen

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Phil comes across footage of an incriminating sneeze while looking at Cameron and Mitchell's wedding video that proves he is responsible for the family's flu epidemic, so he sets about getting rid of the proof with the help of Luke and some creative editing. Claire struggles to make it through an important business meeting while feeling under the weather, while Cam is forced to make a difficult decision when it comes to Manny and the school football team. Mitch meets Lily's know-it-all friend and male nanny Andy (Andy DeVine) makes a welcome return

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The Dunphys move into a hotel while their house is being treated for mould, but when they are forced to share a single room, cabin fever soon sets in. Gloria worries after finding out that Manny is dating one of the popular girls at school, while Cam's attempt to keep his football team's unprecedented winning streak going is threatened by a 'cursed' Mitchell

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The Dunphys are sent into a panic when a loud, obnoxious couple come to look at the house next door. Jay is furious to learn that Manny is dating the granddaughter of his biggest business rival, while Mitch and Cam take on Lily's tyrannical teacher, Mrs Plank. Steve Zahn and Andrea Anders join the cast as new neighbours Ronnie and Amber, with guest star Tyne Daly

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Raj's parents set him up on a blind date in the hope of initiating an arranged marriage, but after a promising start it becomes apparent that the girl in question is more interested in Sheldon. Meanwhile, Penny begins her new job as a bartender. Starring Kunal Nayyar and Jim Parsons

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard and Sheldon receive an invitation to present their research to a physics conference, but Sheldon's reluctance to pander to his peers causes conflict between the friends. An intervention by Penny makes matters worse. Johnny Galecki and Jim Parsons star

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon and Leonard invent excuses to avoid having to attend Penny's performance in a production of the stage musical Rent, but maintaining the pretence makes matters increasingly complicated. Johnny Galecki, Simon Helberg and Kaley Cuoco star, with DJ Qualls

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

The contestants must take on three tricky challenges - a sandwich biscuit for the signature round, a sweet bread-based technical, and a cake showstopper which reveals their favourite guilty pleasure

programme.title: First Dates

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Teaching assistant and burlesque performer Susie, 32, hopes to overcome her dating nerves and stutter to find her 'Prince Charming'. Her date is Star Trek fan Martin from Essex, while 30-year-old hairdresser Bonnie hopes semi-pro boxer Perry is the man for her. However, it remains to be seen if Cupid's arrow strikes any of them

programme.title: The Goldbergs

Gordon Ramsay heads to Easton, Pennsylvania, to help the troubled pair and save the business from financial disaster

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay revisits three restaurants he helped that were among the biggest challenges he faced, finding out whether they stayed on the road to recovery or turned back into nightmares. First he meets sisters Rita and Lisa to see if they have continued serving fresh instead of frozen food at Boston's La Galleria 33, before heading to the Olde Hitching Post in Hanson, Massachusetts, to discover whether controlling owner Tom has kept his promise and handed over the reins to his daughter Andrea. Finally, Gordon goes back to the Prohibition gastro pub in Everett, Washington, to catch up with owner Rishi and learn if she has ditched belly-dancing in favour of running her business

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef heads to Babylon in New York, where the peace of Long Island is regularly shattered by the volatile Pellegrino family, proprietors of Peter's Italian Restaurant. programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard, Raj and Howard kick Sheldon off their physics quiz team and replace him with Leslie Winkle, so he decides to prove his superiority by forming a rival quartet of his own. Johnny Gale and Jim Parsons star

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny makes fun of Leonard's habit of collecting sci-fi memorabilia, so he decides to give it up - but his friends object and do everything possible to persuade him not to change his ways. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon's friends all fall for his sexy twin sister, who is paying him a visit, but he declares he will have the final say on who can date her - an announcement that particularly dismays Leonard. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki and Jim Parsons

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.desc: Following the break-up of Penny's relationship, Leonard finally summons up the courage to ask her out. When she accepts, they both turn to Sheldon for advice on how to handle the forthcoming date. Johnny Galecki, Kaley Cuoco and Jim Parsons star

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Elated at being named one of People magazine's '30 to Watch Under 30', Raj makes a pass at Penny and becomes very arrogant, making it hard for Leonard to maintain a positive perspective on his friend's new-found confidence. Guest starring Charlie Sheen

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon is forced to confront his fear of driving when both Penny and Howard refuse to give him a lift to work. Desperate to be free of the obligation, Leonard and the gang intervene to discover why their friend never learnt to drive. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons and Johnny Galecki, with Octavia Spencer

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon is flattered when a graduate student takes a shine to him, but she thinks his social life is distracting him from his work and removes him from his limited circle of friends by forcing him to work on a troublesome scientific problem. Guest starring Riki Lindhome

There's also 22-year-old pansexual Izzy, who is open to dating any gender, but with so much on offer, will she make the right choice?

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The Emmy-winning comedy returns - as do Cameron and Mitchell, who are back from honeymoon and determined to keep the romance alive. Cameron, however, takes it just a little step too far. The Dunphys, meanwhile, have been enjoying a relaxing summer without smart-alec Alex, who is away on a trip - although she threatens to rock the boat after arriving home early - and Gloria shows a different side after arguing with Jay about the lack of effort he puts into his appearance

Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.desc: Sheldon tries to extend his lifespan, concerned he will not be around long enough for his consciousness to be downloaded into a robot body, and the friends encounter Apple co-founder Steve Wozniak (guest starring as himself) at the Cheesecake Factory

programme.desc: Calvin and Tina enlist the services of a professional matchmaker for Marty, but get too caught up in the process. Dave and Gemma adopt new roles during an unexpected date night

programme.title: Modern Family

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Everyone gathers at Jay and Gloria's to celebrate Alex's graduation, but Phil is devastated to be missing the occasion thanks to an ear infection preventing him from flying home from a business trip to Seattle. Jay frets about Gloria's cousin, who has overstayed his welcome, while Claire stresses about giving Alex the perfect gift. Mitch hides important news from Cam, and Andy and Haley finally come to a realisation about their feelings for each other

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: The prodigy studies his family for a psychology project. Thanksgiving dinner ends up in an argument when Georgie Sr is offered a job in Oklahoma. Comedy prequel to The Big Bang Theory, starring Iain Armitage

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: When the young genius learns that people with stunted childhoods can turn into social outcasts, he tries to act like a stereotypical child. Meemaw and Dr Sturgis' relationship is tested when she teaches him how to drive

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon finds himself forced to keep a secret when Penny decides to tell him what happened on her disappointing first date with Leonard. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Kaley Cuoco and Jim Parsons

programme.title: The Neighborhood

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: When Dave's job requires him to mediate a feud between two wealthy brothers, Calvin tries to help but winds up complicating the process

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty, Kate Quilton and Matt Tebbutt unveil more secrets about the world of mass-produced food. Jimmy heads to the US to find out how the big chunks in American ice-cream stay so crispy, Kate investigates a rise in olive oil prices and finds a disease wiping out olive trees in southern Italy, and Matt discovers why Bloody Marys are so popular on planes - and why airline food tastes very different at ground level

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Sylvia and Martin from Lancashire have been visiting Spain for many years and have now decided the time is right to buy their very own holiday home there to enjoy with their growing family. They have chosen Alora in the Malaga province of southern Spain for its tradition atmosphere and beautiful surrounding countryside. With a budget of £140,000 and Jasmine Harman's expertise on hand, can they find the holiday home of their dreams?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin lines up five properties for Michael and his wife Jane from Sussex, who are looking for a holiday home within easy reach of the coast in Spain's Almeria province. They have a budget of £90,000 and dream of finding a traditional property with modern features that the whole family can enjoy

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Phil Spencer catches up with two sets of discerning house-hunters, each with very strong ideas on what they wanted. The searches may have been tough - in some instances they didn't even make it inside some of the properties - but both have faced even more challenging times since. In 2012, couple Robin and Colin wanted to move outside of London, but only an architectural gem was going to do. In 2014, Lia and Andrew said they were done renting in London's popular Isle of Dogs, and wanted to buy their own home now they were starting a family

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Phil Spencer and Kirstie Allsopp catch up with house hunters who were looking for their dream family home. Chae and Corinna had their hearts set on finding something perfect in Fife, while single mother Jo Beck wanted a permanent home for herself and her two children in Derby

programme.title: Car S.O.S.
programme.desc: Tim and Fuzz take on a 1993 Toyota Supra Mk4 owned by former motorcycle racer Lisa. Her family hope the restored car will lift her spirits after a terrible accident

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Sports fanatic James Cox hosts the first of the week's dinner parties in Northampton, and he is confident that his French-Italian menu will bag him the £1,000 prize. However, some of his guests - Barb Wiles, Donna Harris, Duncan Fielding and Caroline Nash - are left confused by his Vichyssoise soup starter, and the tiramisu causes one of them to choke

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Mother-of-three Donna Harris hosts the second dinner party in Northampton, and hopes that three courses of pure comfort-food will be enough to secure the £1,000 prize. Donna spends almost as much time fixing her make-up as she does preparing the meal, and when guests Duncan Fielding and Caroline Nash discover a secret stash of football shirts, they realise there is more to their hostess than meets the eye

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Part-time actress Caroline Nash is the host on day three of the competition in Northampton, and she hopes that a menu based on her travels will dazzle her guests. However, the night gets off to a shaky start as Donna Harris finds a hair on the side of her goat's cheese salad, while businessman Duncan Fielding seems more interested in goats themselves than the food

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Party-loving Barb Wiles hosts the fourth dinner party in the Northampton area, and hopes her Australian-themed menu will wow her guests and win her the £1,000 prize. However, the competitors are unnerved by her interest in extraterrestrials while snooping around her bedroom, and things go from bad to worse when a seafood starter and undercooked chicken result in tears at the dinner table

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Attention-loving businessman and keen cricketer Duncan Fielding takes centre stage in hosting the final dinner party from Northampton. He creates a menu based on the story of his life - which is full of surprises and full of spice - but it proves a challenge for three of his guests, who like their food mild. His main feature is a chicken and reindeer curry, and the table is impressed to discover that he runs a community pub from the bottom of his garden

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: No-nonsense bikers Wayne and Tracy Dunn arefirst to host at Llwyn Onn Guest House in Betws-y-Coed, north Wales. Former airline cabin crew assistant Nicola Ellershaw makes a less than sparkly discovery when she checks in. Wayne and Tracy challenge their guests to design biker leathers for their own gang, before Jon and Chelli Bean make a shock revelation about Jon's past. At breakfast, Gary Pesticcio challenges his hosts, which his competitors label as game playing, and at feedback time Wayne and Tracy have to face some home truths

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second hosts of the week are newlywed hoteliers Jon and Chelli Bean from the Parkwood Hotel in Stockton-on-Tees

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third hosts of the week are Nicola Ellershaw and Mackenzie Griffey, who hope to impress with the stylish fare on offer at The Pug and Greyhound in Leicestershire

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The guests' final stay is at The Solar Strand Hotel in Crosskeys, Wales, where Gary Pesticcio and his daughter Naomi hope their hi-tech approach to hospitality will impress

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet for the last time to find out what they have been paid, and the atmosphere turns sour when Jon and Chelli Bean disagree with Gary and Naomi Pesticcio's thoughts on their facility. Plus, Nicola Ellershaw and Mackenzie Griffey of The Pug and Greyhound in Great Glen want to unlock the reasons why their rooms were described as being 'like prison cells'

programme.title: The Great British Dig: History in Your Back Garden
programme.desc: Hugh Dennis heads a team excavating back gardens around Britain. Joined by archaeological scientist and lecturer at Newcastle University Dr Chloe Duckworth, field archaeologist Natasha Bilson, and author and archaeologist John Henry Phillips, he reveals a new chapter of Roman history in Cornwall, at a recently discovered Roman fort near Calstock. Little was previously known about the Romans in this part of England, but the indications from the team's excavation are that the Romans were not in the south west solely for a military campaign. Hugh also visits the reconstructed Lunt Roman Fort in Coventry

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The return of the documentary about life inside an A&E department, following patients treated in the same 24-hour period at St George's in south-west London. Fourteen-year-old Eduard is rushed in after falling from a swing and fracturing his ankle, while 62-year-old Rosina is treated having broken her wrist on the dancefloor at a family party. Paula is in Resus having been unable to take in food through her feeding tube and it is not only her health that is in danger, but also that of her unborn baby

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Forty-three-year-old Mohammad, who has motor neurone disease, is rushed to St George's with severe sepsis and doctors work to get the infection under control, while David has fallen 20 feet from a billboard and the trauma team is concerned that the 47-year-old has suffered life-changing injuries. Retired journalist Tom is in the urgent care centre after knocking his arm and his wife Eileen reveals how their plans have been turned upside down due to an unexpected bombshell six weeks previously

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
