programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The return of the documentary about life inside an A&E department, following patients treated in the same 24-hour period at St George's in south-west London. Fourteen-year-old Eduard is rushed in after falling from a swing and fracturing his ankle, while 62-year-old Rosina is treated having broken her wrist on the dancefloor at a family party. Paula is in Resus having been unable to take in food through her feeding tube and it is not only her health that is in danger, but also that of her unborn baby

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Forty-three-year-old Mohammad, who has motor neurone disease, is rushed to St George's with severe sepsis and doctors work to get the infection under control, while David has fallen 20 feet from a billboard and the trauma team is concerned that the 47-year-old has suffered life-changing injuries. Retired journalist Tom is in the urgent care centre after knocking his arm and his wife Eileen reveals how their plans have been turned upside down due to an unexpected bombshell six weeks previously

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Essex couple Belinda and Alan have decided to take the leap and buy a property in or around the pretty seaside resort of La Cala de Mijas in Spain's Costa del Sol. They call upon the expertise of Laura Hamilton, who finds five options to show them within their £160,000 budget

programme.title: George Clarke's Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: George looks back at his first ever big build, in which he enlisted the help of friend and design guru Will Hardie to convert a dilapidated 1970s caravan bought for £300 into a stylish holiday home for him and his children. Along the way, George takes inspiration from other ingenious caravan and self-build conversions, including lovingly restored gypsy wagons - and to make the most of the space, he even comes up with a sofa that doubles up as a bath

programme.title: Ugly House to Lovely House with George Clarke
programme.desc: Sue and Simon bought their four-bedroom Hertfordshire home in 2014, but the fake-Victorian extension has given the property a bad layout which is proving something of a nightmare. The couple also believe their home is by far the ugliest on their street. Enter architect Laura Jane Clark, who specialises in breathing new life into unappealing spaces. She has a plan to entirely transform the interior by moving the staircase, putting in skylights and installing an innovative revolving wall. However, Sue and Simon have a tight budget of £50,000 - and that's before they've even started on the exterior

programme.title: George Clarke's Old House, New Home
programme.desc: George visits a Victorian villa in Leeds, West Yorkshire, where Jawad and Charlie are planning a master en-suite which, if the rest of their quirky renovations are anything to go by, looks set to be a mammoth task. He also helps Jason and Hannah in Brixton, south London, who are tackling an ambitious two-storey extension. The big question is - should they lose their redundant chimney breast and increase the size of the room?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: First aid manager Jacqui hosts the first dinner party in Perth, where she plans to impress her guests, optometric consultant Daniel, cabinet-maker Craig, administrator Lorea and procurement officer Jenna with her hearty cuisine, including a sticky toffee pudding

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Aspiring actor Daniel hosts the second dinner party in Perth, and hopes to impress his fellow contestants with a twist on the traditional Scottish menu - serving spaghetti hagginaise for his main and soft-drink flavoured ice-cream for dessert. But with outspoken guest Jenna admitting her dislike for the host, the attention is diverted away from the food

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: For the third party from Perth, Lorea is on a mission to showcase the culinary delights of her native home in northern Spain, and her fiesta commences with a pink cocktail and an exotic quartet flown over from the Basque country especially to impress. She reveals that she used to model in the nude, which perplexes her guests, and there are tensions at bay between Daniel and Jenna, which threaten to spoil the evening

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Procurement officer Jenna hosts the fourth night of the competition in Perth, and tries to deliver the perfect evening. However, she struggles to hide her feelings toward aspiring actor Daniel after they have bickered all week, despite first aid manager Jacqui's attempts at reconciliation

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It is the final day in Perth, and Kiwi Craig's turn to throw a dinner party before the winner is named. He hopes that his land and sea menu of prime lobster and wild boar will see him score highly, but hadn't counted on Jenna and Craig's tiara quarrel from the night before raging on into his evening. The host tries his best to calm the couple, but tensions mount to the point where cutlery is slammed down and one guest storms out

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts at The Shoes in Durham, where landlord Billy Gowland and partner Debbie Nelson hope their footwear-themed pub and B&B is the right fit for their visitors. Guests Annie and James show their artistic streaks when they're challenged to create a unique piece of shoe art. Charles and Lisa from glampsite Forest Garden Shovelstrode have some advice for their hosts. At dinner, Fiona and James from the Derby Manor Hotel and Restaurant are confused by Annie and James' eccentric conversation

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: At Biggin Hall Hotel in Derbyshire, owner James Moffat and partner Annie Larner hope the B&Bers will fall for the rural charm of their 17th-century farmhouse

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit the group head to Forest Garden Shovelstrode in East Sussex, where hosts Charles and Lisa Hooper hope the guests buy into their woodland retreat

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Derby Manor Hotel and Restaurant, where mother-and-son team Fiona and James Milligan opened their doors eight months earlier after a £1million refurbishment. With a red carpet and over 6,000 hand-glued diamante studs on the walls, some of the guests compare the decor to Dubai. They get a taste of life in the fast lane when James lets them take the hotel's fleet of premium hire cars out for a spin. And later, during a remote control car race, there's some unexpected behaviour from one guest. Fiona and James are expecting good feedback, but have to confront the fact that their guests wouldn't all be keen to return

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners find out what they have been paid and settle some scores. The Shoes is up first and hosts Billy Gowland and his partner Debbie Nelson find out if their budget rooms have proved too basic for the group. Next, James Moffat and his partner Annie Larner from Biggin Hall Hotel want to clear up their issues with Billy and Debbie. As the third hosts, Charles and Lisa Hooper from yurt glamp-site Forest Garden Shovelstrode confront their low scores from James. Finally, Fiona and James from the Derby Manor Hotel and Restaurant make accusations of nitpicking and double standards

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Zumba teacher Amanda hosts the first dinner party in Weston-super-Mare, where she hopes to impress her guests Harry, drama teacher Nancy, businesswoman Tracy and estate manager Chris with a locally sourced Somerset menu. Although the evening starts off with some friendly banter, it soon turns sour for some of the contestants

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Rugby fan and sports centre manager Harry hosts the second night in Weston-super-Mare, where he hopes to wow his guests with a traditional Hungarian menu, complete with beef in hunter's sauce and bird's milk with meringue dumplings

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Weston-super-Mare, drama teacher and music lover Nancy throws an Austrian-themed party to reflect her love of the country and its music, with a menu featuring wiener schnitzel and venison stew. The starter proves to be a hit with the guests, but her main course fails to impress, and the atmosphere grows tense when Chris compares her dessert to the worst food experience of his life

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Farm-estate manager Chris hosts the fourth party in Weston-super-Mare, Somerset, and hopes his African-based menu can impress his guests. He serves savoury doughnuts, which are a new experience for his fellow diners. However, his main course of deep fried beef doesn't go down as well, leaving his chances of winning the competition resting on the evening's entertainment

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Businesswoman Tracy hosts the final dinner party in Weston-super-Mare, and her dance-inspired evening includes lessons in cha-cha and tango as well as a black-tie dress code. programme.title: 999: On the Front Line

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E

Eighty-three-year-old Roy is brought into resus after falling off his roof at home, and doctors are concerned that he may have sustained internal injuries, while, five-year-old Laila has come to paediatrics with her mum Clarissa after cutting her head open at school

programme.title: The Emergency Ward
programme.desc: Dr Mya and Dr David treat a young woman with a broken jaw who is at risk of choking after falling off her horse - and is in a world of pain

programme.title: The Good Doctor

Kay loves the stunning scenery of Cardigan Bay in west Wales, while sun-worshipper Chris would rather move to the beautiful Mar Menor in Spain. programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of probate detectives. A man travels 9,000 miles to meet his half-sister for the first time, while a surprise adoption and travelling ancestors threaten to derail the search for a Leicester City fan's heirs

programme.title: Heir Hunters

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at Rob and Jo Smith's dog-friendly B&B in Hope Mountain, north Wales. Eyebrows are raised when self-styled 'queens of clean' Steffi Stephenson and Sarah Banks find evidence of their pet hate. During an afternoon making jam, identical twins Fernando and Emilio Tundidor reveal a competitive streak. At breakfast, Denise and Alan Newman are surprisingly demanding

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final day in the competition sees the B&B owners meet up for the last time to find out what they have been paid and settle some scores

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau
programme.desc: The temperatures soar as Dick and Angel face the busiest period of the year, as the school holidays coincide with peak wedding season. Dick comes up with an ingenious solution to stop wedding cakes from melting in the heat, but it involves piercing the chateau's walls. The moat is transformed into a boating lake, giving visitors a chance to cool down, and the family takes to the water in a home-made punt

Plus, Stanley the anxious Staffie meets 'dog-mad' pair Linda and Richard

Having recently been diagnosed with multiple sclerosis, Angelo wants to create a retreat to help him cope with the news and become a 21st-century caveman. He has a budget of £100,000 and plans to almost single-handedly carve, cut and drill into the hillside to make the cave comfortable for contemporary living. However, there is no manual for a project of this kind, and the unique challenge soon becomes an obsession

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May embark on a race from London's Wembley Stadium to Milan's San Siro, the home of Italian football giants AC and Inter. A price restriction leads Jeremy to grab the keys to a Shelby Mustang GT500, which costs the equivalent of £35,000 in America and packs a supercharged punch of more than 650bhp. James and Richard pin their hopes on the pan-European rail network in a bid to secure the prize of tickets to a top-flight football match, with nothing but a long journey home awaiting the losers. On the test track, Jeremy puts Toyota's GT86 coupe through its paces, and its promise of entertaining rear-wheel-drive handling should put a smile on his face. Plus, singer-songwriter Amy Macdonald gets to grips with the Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson puts the Kia Cee'd through a rigorous but peculiar road test featuring eels, curry, a rock legend, an American police officer and an unusual game of rugby involving James May. Richard Hammond gets behind the wheel of the Mastretta MXT, but worries about the repercussions of a comment he made in a previous episode about Mexico, the sports car's country of manufacture. Plus, three high-performance hatchbacks are driven with gusto around the test track, and Formula One driver Lewis Hamilton gets a second chance to smash the lap record

programme.title: Bangers & Cash

programme.title: Bangers & Cash
programme.desc: Dave's on his way to Grimsby to pick up an iconic 80s fast Ford, the Mk1 Fiesta XR2, while Bubbles regrets sitting in an immaculate Morris 1800 which he's now desperate to bid on

programme.title: Bangers & Cash
programme.desc: Derek gets a tour of Hadlow Castle in Kent when he arrives to collect the owner's pre-war Alvis and an immaculate Citroen used by the Gestapo in occupied France

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: An abandoned railway station near a town in Spain that is home to just 500 people and a record-breaking Arctic facility that goes deep below the surface

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The story of how a town established by Henry Ford in the 1920s has been left to rot in the Amazonian rainforest. Plus, Mysterious monoliths scattered over a Polish forest

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: An advanced German battleship that sank in a Norwegian fjord during the Second World War, the Miles Glacier Bridge in Alaska, and a mysterious concrete giant in Bulgaria

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Steered by his 1913 Bradshaw railway guide, Michael Portillo takes the train down the spine of Italy as he travels from Rome to Sicily. He begins by weaving among the capital city's landmarks on the back of a 1950s Vespa, before boarding the train south to Naples, where he finds out about the first railway to be built in the country, and ventures into the crater of Mount Vesuvius. He takes a detour to the island of Capri, before finishing his journey in the ancient hilltop town of Taormina

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo uses his 1913 copy of Bradshaw's Continental Railway Guide to explore Poland. He begins in the capital Warsaw, where he takes to the floor to dance to one of Chopin's polonaises with high-school students rehearsing for their leavers' ball, before discovering how the former industrial city of Lodz supplied the vast Russian empire of the early 20th century. He then heads to Poznan and rides one of the few remaining steam-powered commuter trains, visits a factory in Wroclaw that manufactures car bodies for locomotives, and ends his journey in Krakow, where he takes a tour in an iconic vehicle of the communist era

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo uses his 1913 copy of Bradshaw's Continental Railway Guide as he travels through Spain and Portugal. He begins in the city of La Coruna, where he examines the Celtic roots of the Galician people and tries to master the bagpipes, before meeting walkers from all over the world on the pilgrims' trail to Santiago de Compostela. Heading across the border to Porto, Michael finds out about the origins of Britain's long alliance with the Portuguese, and finishes his journey in the capital Lisbon

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo uses his 1913 copy of Bradshaw's Continental Railway Guide to venture beyond Europe as he travels through the Holy Land. He begins in Israel, learning about the Baha'i faith and how it spread to Britain in the Edwardian era, hearing the story of the origins of Tel Aviv, and visiting the Christian, Jewish and Muslim quarters of the capital Jerusalem. Michael then crosses the separation barrier between Jerusalem and the West Bank in the company of his Palestinian guide and meets the embroiderers of the Arab Women's Union in Bethlehem, before finishing his journey in the Negev desert

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo follows in the footsteps of Edwardian travellers to trace a route recommended in his Bradshaw's guide from the heart of France to the Mediterranean coast. His journey begins in Lyon, where he learns how the city got its gastronomic reputation, and takes instruction from a leading chef on making an omelette. In Avignon, he samples a glass of the region's famous wine Chateauneuf-du-Pape, before his journey ends at the Mediterranean port of Marseille, where he joins a pilot boat as it leads a supertanker to its berth

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Armed with his trusty 1913 Bradshaw's Continental Railway Guide, Michael Portillo travels east through the Balkans along the most exotic section of the route taken by the Orient Express. His journey begins in Sofia, capital of Bulgaria, and includes stops in the ancient city of Plovdiv, the region of Rumelia, and former capital of the Ottoman Empire Edirne. Arriving in Istanbul, Michael takes a trip on the Bosphorus - a much-coveted stretch of water - finds out about Turkish delight and travels along the Marmaray metro line, which connects European and Asian Istanbul via a tunnel beneath the Bosphorus

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: The Meldrews return home from a dreary holiday to find the neighbours about to sell their house to a weirdo - and while Victor is busy moaning about everything under the sun, Margaret considers embarking on an affair. Comedy, starring Richard Wilson and Annette Crosbie

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: Victor is stuck at home while waiting to be called for jury service - but as time ticks on and his frustration grows, he begins to feel as if he is the one on trial. Richard Wilson stars in an episode featuring no other characters

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: Victor lands himself in a pickle thanks to a conjuring trick that proves to be far from magic, while busybody Mrs Warboys becomes convinced her husband is having an affair. Comedy, starring Richard Wilson and Annette Crosbie

programme.title: Rise of the Nazis
programme.desc: Dramatised documentary examining how Hitler and the Nazi party rose to power in Germany during the 1930s, revealing the greed, manipulation and frightening underestimation of Adolf Hitler's ambition. In 1930, Germany was a liberal democracy, with elections, parliament and the rule of law, but just four years later its leader was a dictator and its government is in the hands of murderers. Leading historians and experts take viewers inside the minds of those hellbent on gaining power and those who tried to stop them

programme.title: Rise of the Nazis
programme.desc: It is 1933 and Adolf Hitler is the chancellor of Germany, but he does not have absolute power as there is still a democratic parliament, a head of state and the rule of law. Hitler calls a general election to increase Nazi representation, but a fire in the Reichstag building is blamed on communists - prompting thousands of arrests of left-wingers. Hitler then calls on President von Hindenburg to act and a decree is passed giving the Nazis emergency powers to ban free speech and the right to protest

programme.title: Rise of the Nazis
programme.desc: The final episode examines the infamous Night of the Long Knives in late June and early July of 1934, when Adolf Hitler - urged on by Hermann Goering and Heinrich Himmler - ordered a series of political executions on those seen as a threat to the Nazi regime. The most well-known of these was Ernst Roehm, commander and co-founder of the Sturmabteilung, the Nazi Party's militia, whom Hitler had come to see as a potential rival. At least 85 people died during the purge, although the final death toll may have been in the hundreds

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: Documentary uncovering and examining hidden structures built by the Nazis, from tunnels to towers, artillery sites, resistance nests and communication centres. The first edition focuses on the Channel Island of Guernsey, which Hitler occupied and fortified over the course of five years

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on a journey from Ayr to Skye. He begins by visiting the home town of poet Robert Burns and finds out how to make haggis. He then discovers the way in which the railway transformed the game of golf in Prestwick, and uncovers the story of the great Victorian tartan hoax in Paisley

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on the second leg of his journey along the west coast of Scotland from Ayr to Skye, stopping off to explore the Dumbarton shipyards that were responsible for the construction of the famous Cutty Sark. He also goes hunting for gold in the mountains, and visits Loch Lomond, one of Queen Victoria's favourite haunts

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his journey up the west coast of Scotland and discovers how trains helped spread the reputation of Oban whisky. He also learns about the efforts to build a railway through the desolate Rannoch Moor and visits Corrour, a favourite shooting estate of the political elite in Victorian times

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his journey from Ayr to Skye and investigates the parallel 'roads' etched in the side of Glen Roy - one of the geological mysteries of the 19th century. He also finds out how the Victorians put a weather observatory on the top of Ben Nevis, and crosses the Glenfinnan viaduct by steam train

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: In the final leg of his journey from Ayr to Skye, Michael Portillo discovers how the railways provided Second World War commandos with the means to travel to the isolated landscape of Lochailort, where they were able to train without attracting the attention of German spies. He also learns why langoustines have replaced herring as the best catch in the fishing port of Mallaig, and explores the history of Highland crofters

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo learns more about the country's railways, beginning with the Great Eastern Line, which runs along the edge of England and into central London. On his travels, the former politician discovers the grave-robbing history of Great Yarmouth and tries his hand at working a Victorian swing bridge in Reedham, Norfolk. He also takes to the air to reveal how a rail guidebook helped aviators during the Second World War

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his journey along the Great Eastern Line, which ventures from the edge of England to the heart of London. In this leg, he examines the Victorians' fascination with the Suffolk village of Dunwich, Britain's answer to Atlantis, and discovers how nearby Felixstowe became home to the UK's biggest container port

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo visits the sites of Victorian freak shows, rides one of the world's first electric railways in Southend and encounters the preserved head of a medieval politician as he continues his journey along the route of the Great Eastern Line

programme.desc: Documentary set inside Woodgreen animal charity, following efforts to match dogs with new owners. Nine-year-old Rohan meets Patterdale terrier puppy Friday, but there are concerns that the hound may be just a bit too enthusiastic for the youngster. Rocco the Jack Russell has been struggling to find a home, though his bouncy exuberance and love of a good face lick means he could be the perfect match for Zach, who is looking for a dog not fazed by his Tourette's. programme.title: Married to a Psychopath
programme.desc: Part two of two. The covert investigation into Malcolm Webster in light of evidence that he attempted to kill his second wife in similar circumstances to his first wife's death over a decade before. As Webster targets his third victim, a wealthy nurse whom he plans to bigamously marry, time is running out for the investigating officers as they learn that the bride and groom will be honeymooning aboard a yacht sailing into international water

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Lynn is rushed to St George's after collapsing from a brain aneurysm. Her friend Mick tells the story of their lifelong friendship and reveals how she overcame serious health problems with the support of him and his wife. James is treated for a dislocated shoulder, and 30-year-old Lucas has a suspected urinary tract infection

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody
programme.desc: Part one of a two-part special exploring the largest ever unsolved murder case in the history of Cambridgeshire Police, the murder of a six-year-old child in 1994. Initial investigations pointed to the boy's mother, who seemed to have an interest in murder and black magic. When a new team takes over, they uncover flaws in the original police work and a compelling new lead

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody
programme.desc: Concluding the investigation into the 1994 murder of six-year-old Rikki Neave. Fifteen years after Rikki's mother was cleared of his murder following a flawed police investigation, a team of dedicated officers from the Major Crime Unit of Cambridgeshire police were authorised to begin a fresh investigation. Analysis of the evidence put a new suspect, James Watson, who was 13 at the time of the killing, together with Rikki on the day of his disappearance. But despite a forensic breakthrough, Watson presented the officers with a conundrum that made it difficult to prove the case against him

programme.title: Catching a Killer
programme.desc: When elderly teacher Peter Farquhar was found dead at home in the village of Maids Moreton in 2015, it was sad and unexpected, but no one thought it suspicious. But 18 months later, when his neighbour Ann Moore-Martin also fell ill and died, the police decided to look again. They found that Ben Field, a would-be vicar and academic, had recently become part of both of their lives and benefited from their wills. This programme shows that by delving back in time through friends' and loved ones' memories of Peter and Ben's relationship, as well as Peter's diary, the police discovered a story of love and betrayal

programme.title: Moors Murders
programme.desc: Analysis of never-before-seen letters from Ian Brady and Myra Hindley, written over their five decades in prison, and personal accounts from those who knew them. The first episode features an eyewitness account of the last murder from Myra Hindley's brother-in-law David Smith, and contributions from 1960s pop singer Janie Jones, who befriended Hindley in prison and conducted a 40-year-long correspondence with both Hindley and Brady

Phil managed to find one with a cat flap already installed for £25,000 under-budget, now he visits them at a different property to find they have upsized in more ways than one. programme.title: Celebrity Gogglebox
programme.desc: Some of the nation's top personalities turn their hand to being the country's most opinionated viewers as they critique the week's TV. Giving their view on the most talked about television of the week are Davina McCall with her partner Michael Douglas, Katherine Ryan and her husband Bobby, Rob Beckett and Tom Allen, Tom Grennan and his dad Martin, naturalist Chris Packham with his step-daughter Megan, Big Zuu, Hyder and Tubsey, Paul Sinha and husband Olly, Nick Grimshaw and his niece Liv, Shaun Ryder and Bez, Martin and Roman Kemp, and married couple Clare Balding and Alice Arnold

programme.title: Extraordinary Escapes with Sandi Toksvig
programme.desc: Sandi is joined by comedian Judi Love for a tour of the Lake District as they stay in the best staycation hideaways they can find. Starting at the Gaia Farmhouse by Ullswater, Judi enjoys the sights and sounds of the season and Sandi feels the heat when Judi cooks an exceedingly spicy take on cottage pie. The pair then head to the Lingholm Estate to stay in a unique boathouse that floats over a wild and stormy Derwentwater and go for a very choppy boat ride. The adventure concludes on the banks of Windermere in Grey Gables where Sandi and Judi unwind with some wine-time and homemade watercolour postcards

programme.title: Five Star Kitchen: Britain's Next Great Chef
programme.desc: The remaining seven chefs are tasked to produce an extravagant dish using the finest ingredients money can buy. Exorbitant price tags and the world's rarest delicacies abound as the chefs compete to appeal to the Langham hotel's millionaire clientele. Those who fail to impress undertake a second challenge in a fight for survival. To prove their business acumen, they must devise a £30 lunch menu and run a busy Langham lunch service. Tension overflows in the kitchen and the chef who brings in the least profit is eliminated. Michel Roux Jr, Ravneet Gill and Mike Reid judge their efforts

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at My Way Guest House in Broompark, Co Durham, where Kaye Horner and her daughter Lily are counting on their cleanliness to gain top marks

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The first of the week's dinner parties in Medway, Kent, is hosted by experimental cook and retired grandmother Nina Gaskell. Her guests are barmaid Laura Leibo, police worker Esther Kennedy, mortgage adviser Michael Dodsworth and art graduate Patrick Fysh, and she hopes to impress them with her unusual dishes including a cucumber stuffed with corned beef, and gravy with coconut

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Lincolnshire and Yorkshire are the settings for the latest culinary contest. First to host are loved-up Mel and Bianca, who hope to impress with their South African menu. Day two sees Jaq and Jim attempt to blow away the opposition, while Chris and Liz present a posh take on some Yorkshire classic dishes. There is also a surprise in store for Bianca

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Sara Damergi takes sisters Annabel and Victoria to the Costa del Sol, where their parents used to own a holiday home. Victoria plans to invest £100,000 on an accessible apartment that they can share

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman comes to the aid of Colin and Tina, who are torn between a £200,000 property in Yorkshire and a life abroad. Tina is reluctant to move too far away from her family, but Colin is convinced their future lies in the Alentejo region of Portugal

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Retirees Pauline and Peter have been coming to the Canary Island of Lanzarote separately for over 15 years, and even met and fell for each other there. Now, with five children and 15 grandchildren between them, they feel that the time is right to buy their own holiday home in their favourite resort of Playa Blanca. Jasmine Harman provides options for the pair, within their budget of £350,000

programme.title: Sarah Beeny's New Country Lives
programme.desc: Matt and Lorraine want to create a new front entrance to their quirky country home, but uncover problems above and below ground. Sarah Beeny follows their progress

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Simon O'Brien and Henry Cole explore some old chicken sheds piled high with stuff in Lincolnshire, finding a toilet cistern and a dressing room mirror to fix up

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The competition comes from in and around Hastings and Rye in East Sussex, where the first host is 52-year-old nursery owner Louise, who plans a fun-filled evening of Thai food. Her guests are horse-mad Emily, who's 40, 56-year-old Caribbean takeaway owner Clive, 23-year-old beauty therapist Chiara and mature student and self-confessed foodie Gary. A power cut threatens to scupper Louise's night before it's even started, until her husband - and farmer - Roddy and his generator come to the rescue. Will the night impress the guests, and particularly the self-appointed Thai food expert at the table?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The second night from Hastings and Rye in East Sussex sees host Emily plan an evening of comfort food, including carrot and parsnip soup, meat loaf and apple and blackberry crumble

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Australian mature student Gary hosts the third dinner party from Hastings and Rye, East Sussex, planning an evening filled with fun, flash and fabulous flavour

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Dec, a former member of 1960s band the Bachelors, hosts the next dinner party from Hastings and Rye, planning to impress his guests with musical surprises and a simple seaside menu

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On the final night in Hastings and Rye, East Sussex, beauty therapist Chiara returns to her roots to throw an Italian dinner party. However, Irish crooner Dec gets on his host's wrong side when he questions her interest in healing crystals and likens her to a page three glamour girl

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jo and DP are looking for a holiday home in Nerja on Spain's ever-popular Costa del Sol that they can escape to in the winter and rent out in the summer to support them in their retirement. Ben Hillman lines up five options for the pair to consider

programme.title: George Clarke's Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: A Nottingham couple cement their relationship with an ambitious floating home, while in London George discovers an explosion of global architecture in a tiny one-bedroom flat. In Lincolnshire, family relations are put to the test as two teenage siblings take on the task of building their own mobile homes away from home. Plus, together with master craftsman Will Hardie, George conjures up a magical 30-mile vista in a wall just 20cm thick in their secret garden studio flat

programme.title: Britain's Most Expensive Houses
programme.desc: Documentary following the brokers at UK Sotheby's International Realty. The super prime property market is booming and competition to court ultra-high-net-worth individuals with money to spend is fierce. This programme features a grade I listed terraced home for sale overlooking Regents Park Lake. Built in 1822 and designed by renowned Regency architect John Nash, it's worth an eye-watering £29million, making it one of the most expensive homes in the UK. Also in London, managing director of UK Sotheby's International Realty Guy is invited to sell a rather unusual houseboat boasting five bedrooms and three bathrooms

programme.title: Catching a Killer
programme.desc: When elderly teacher Peter Farquhar was found dead at home in the village of Maids Moreton in 2015, it was sad and unexpected, but no one thought it suspicious. But 18 months later, when his neighbour Ann Moore-Martin also fell ill and died, the police decided to look again. They found that Ben Field, a would-be vicar and academic, had recently become part of both of their lives and benefited from their wills. This programme shows that by delving back in time through friends' and loved ones' memories of Peter and Ben's relationship, as well as Peter's diary, the police discovered a story of love and betrayal

programme.title: Celebrity Gogglebox
programme.desc: Some of the nation's top personalities turn their hand to being the country's most opinionated viewers as they critique the week's TV. programme.title: Moors Murders
programme.desc: Analysis of never-before-seen letters from Ian Brady and Myra Hindley, written over their five decades in prison, and personal accounts from those who knew them. The first episode features an eyewitness account of the last murder from Myra Hindley's brother-in-law David Smith, and contributions from 1960s pop singer Janie Jones, who befriended Hindley in prison and conducted a 40-year-long correspondence with both Hindley and Brady

programme.title: Wonders of the World I Can't See
programme.desc: Blind comedian Chris McCausland explores some of the world's most iconic landmarks to discover things that the ordinary traveller might miss. Chris is joined by Harry Hill for a trip to the Acropolis in the Greek capital Athens. They soak up some local culture, including sea fishing, pottery making, olive oil tasting and Greek drama lessons, and even try their hand at a few Olympic sports in the iconic Panathenaic Stadium

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jon Richardson and Joe Wilkinson take on Lee Mack and Katherine Ryan in the comedy words-and-numbers game, while the Brett Domino Trio join Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner. Hosted by Jimmy Carr, with Rachel Riley looking after the numbers and letters

programme.title: Shocking Emergency Calls
programme.desc: Documentary telling the story of the day a gunman entered a bank in Cincinnati and opened fire, featuring the calls made by those caught up in the atrocity

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.desc: Trainer Graeme Hall tries to solve more dog behavioural problems. programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston returns with a focus on officers on patrol in North Yorkshire, beginning as they clamp down on young drivers causing danger on the county's roads. On the outskirts of York, officers suspect drugs are involved when a young, speeding driver collides with a lorry, while police are forced to use a stinger and puncture three tyres to stop a repeat drunk and drugged driver near Selby

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: Officers in York are forced into one of their most dangerous pursuits after a report of a stolen car travelling at recklessly high speeds towards the city centre. programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: A prolific car thief with a string of convictions under his belt crashes and rolls a stolen car at over 100mph, while in Harrogate the hunt for a cloned car and disqualified driver leads to a high-speed pursuit. programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Kev Salter takes drastic action to stop a vehicle he suspects has class-A drugs on board, while a nasty street fight leads to a Taser being drawn. programme.title: Police Interceptors

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: A reckless car thief seems intent on causing carnage, while the pursuit of an unlicensed driver through a housing estate has grave consequences. programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Ortis Deley follows officers from Cleveland and Durham's specialist unit as they embark on a series of operations targeting crimes connected to narcotics. programme.desc: Officers begin an investigation after a driver loses control of his car and hits a motorway central reservation before spinning out of control and crossing two live lanes of the A1. programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: In North Yorkshire, more than a thousand drink-drivers are arrested every year meaning police are always looking out for suspicious cars and drivers taking their chances. Meanwhile in Blackpool, John tries to evict a difficult tenant who has been caught stealing electricity on more than one occasion

programme.desc: Hull Royal Infirmary staff have to deal with abusive patients disrupting care due to Covid restrictions preventing family members from entering the waiting room. After her motorcycle collided with a deer at 60mph, 56-year-old Tracy is rushed in, and consultant Dr Andy must establish why she is having trouble feeling her legs, while Adam is devastated when an accident in the gym means he may not be able to compete in Hull's strongest man contest

programme.title: 10 Years Younger in 10 Days

programme.title: GPs: Behind Closed Doors

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Jessica visits a lakeside resort to complete her latest mystery novel, only to be sidetracked by a real-life killing when she sees a woman fall from a boat. Starring Angela Lansbury, Tom Bosley and John Astin

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: After a woman is electrocuted and killed in her bathtub, Cabot Cove is flooded with pen point letters that turn neighbours against each other. Starring Angela Lansbury, Tom Bosley and John Astin

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Jessica discovers a suspicious death in the desert, during an archaeological excavation for gold at a Native American site in New Mexico. Mystery, starring Angela Lansbury and William Windom

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Jessica visits a cosmetics convention, where she is soon called on to investigate the murder of a make-up magnate's fiancee, and finds herself caught up in a family feud. Mystery, starring Angela Lansbury, Jayne Meadows and Robert Culp

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Jessica is called for jury duty in the trial of a murder suspect claiming self-defence, but she realises there is more to the case than meets the eye. Drama, starring Angela Lansbury

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: Gideon interrogates a serial killer in a Nevada restaurant surrounded by police, determined to uncover the whereabouts of a hostage he is holding captive - but despite his situation, the criminal remains adamant he will walk free due to a lack of forensic evidence

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: A serial killer targets women at a college in Flagstaff, Arizona. However, when another murder takes place while the suspect is in custody, the agents begin to doubt themselves

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A sports reporter seeks Benson's help to accuse a cameraman of rape, but only agrees to press charges after she discovers the man is stalking her. Before the trial begins the team finds out she is pregnant, and ADA Barba must contend with questionable defence tactics as a result

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The SVU detectives investigate after a school nurse notices multiple injuries on a young girl. It soon becomes clear that they must stop a clinically psychopathic boy with homicidal tendencies. Hard-hitting and emotional series chronicling the life and crimes of the New York Police Department, starring Mariska Hargitay and Dann Florek

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Part one of two. A military aircraft transporting the bodies of dead US marines back home crashes before reaching its destination, and Gibbs and the team are called in to help identify human remains at the site of the wreckage. However, a DNA discrepancy turns a routine investigation into a search for a missing person. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Dick Reed, a rapist and murderer regarded as one of New York's most dangerous criminals, is released from prison after DNA evidence from his trial is discredited. Convinced he will re-offend, Erin tries to persuade the only woman to survive one of his attacks to testify against him - but her emotional scars may be too much to overcome. Meanwhile, Danny and Jackie discover Reed's murderous exploits have inspired a cabal of copycat admirers. Guest starring Toby Leonard Moore (The Pacific)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Danny investigates the murder of a nightclub doorman, and strikes up a rapport with the venue's female owner - much to his wife's chagrin. Police drama, starring Tom Selleck and Donnie Wahlberg

programme.desc: An agelong actress grows desperate to recapture her glory days and resorts to murdering her husband and making it look like suicide. Crime drama, starring Peter Falk, Janet Leigh, Sam Safe and John Payne

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: The owner of a shipbuilding business disapproves of his son's plans for the company, and announces his intention to sell up. However, that night, he is murdered and his body dumped at sea. The crumpled cop, joined by two sidekicks, becomes convinced the victim's son is responsible - but everything is not as it seems. Crime drama, starring Peter Falk and Robert Vaughn, directed by Patrick McGoohan

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: The slovenly sleuth suspects the owner of a men's magazine is behind the strange disappearance of his business partner and former lover. The suspect insists the woman is still alive, while the detective struggles to prove his guilt owing to the absence of a body. Crime drama, starring Peter Falk, Ian Buchanan, Rebecca Staab, Deidre Hall and Alan Scarfe

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: A successful photographer wants to get rid of his nagging wife so he can pursue an affair with his assistant. He murders his spouse and makes it look as if she was killed by a kidnapper, and at the same time puts an ex-con in the frame. However, the dogged detective sees through his ruse and proceeds to pick the story to pieces. Crime drama, with Peter Falk, Dick Van Dyke, Don Gordon and Antoinette Bower

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: A stage magician has kept the fact that he is a Nazi war criminal a secret for years. When a nightclub manager threatens to expose him, the illusionist kills him and arranges the perfect alibi - because at the time of the murder, he was apparently performing an escapology act. However, Columbo sets out to uncover the truth. Detective drama, with Peter Falk and Jack Cassidy

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: A possessive painter who fears his ex-wife will expose his dark secrets resorts to killing her, but makes it appear she drowned. However, Columbo is unconvinced and draws on his broad palette of experience to reveal the truth. Detective drama, starring Peter Falk, Patrick Bauchau and Fionnula Flanagan

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: An explosion at an apartment building brings navy officer Terence Keith to the team's attention and it transpires he had been on medication for anxiety, a condition that had led to him being ejected from a pilot's training course. Ducky's profile of Keith suggests that he may be unstable and about to exact revenge for having his dream of becoming a fighter ace taken away from him, and evidence points to him intending to carry out a suicide attack

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A local college student is sexually assaulted, and the SVU detectives utilise every strategy they have to uncover a massive conspiracy involving the university's leading administrators. Rollins and Benson visit the victim at a psychiatric hospital, where she is undergoing electroshock therapy to erase the memories of her attack

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: When a high-school teen is gang-raped at a rock concert, Amaro finds himself trying to save the reputation of the prime suspect, an army veteran with Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder and a fragmented memory of exactly what happened on the night concerned. Jeffrey Tambor guest stars alongside Mariska Hargitay and Ice-T

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Part two of two. Ziva and Gibbs lead the mission to rescue the captured Marine in Afghanistan before discovering that her captor's brothers have bigger plans and are at large in America. Gibbs has to be stopped when he tries to employ methods similar to those used on Kinah and Lala in an effort to gain information, but Vance has a trick that gives the agents an idea of what the siblings have in mind

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Tony is forced to tackle a case with a personal element when his father is discovered drunk in a car that has a dead body in the boot. The victim is revealed to be Navy lieutenant Dean Massey, who DiNozzo Sr had threatened to kill after being cut out of a land development deal. Guest starring Robert Wagner

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: An unsolved case from Frank's past resurfaces when a boy's body is discovered at a building site - and he struggles to keep a clear head while searching for the killer. Drama, starring Tom Selleck and Donnie Wahlberg

Drama, starring Tom Selleck and Donnie Wahlberg

Meanwhile, FBI Agent Fornell joins the unit

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Part two of three. A witness reveals that personal trainer Newman flew to Los Angeles on the night of the murder, leading the officers to believe they have the wrong man. When blood matching the dead film studio executive's is found in their new suspect's car, they soon arrest him but their case may not be clear-cut enough to warrant a conviction. Sam Waterston stars

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Conclusion of a three-part story. The investigation into a movie studio boss's murder becomes further complicated when fresh evidence points to yet another suspect. Meanwhile, the ex-husband of the deceased goes to trial to face accusations of having a hand in the crime - is an innocent man about to be convicted? Sam Waterston stars

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A woman is attacked and killed just hours after a serial rapist is freed on parole, prompting McCoy to pull out all the stops to bring him to justice - but before long the detective realises the wanted man could be innocent. Drama, starring Sam Waterston and Jerry Orbach

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: McCoy tries to trap a crooked lawyer who bribes his clients - but as he tries to track down the man's accomplice, he realises the investigation has placed his own job on the line. Award-winning police drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Benjamin Bratt

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: An answering machine message leads Briscoe and Curtis to reopen an investigation into an arson attack that killed a girl - but the 15-year-old suspect has a powerful ally in his grandfather, an influential force in political spheres. Award-winning police drama, guest starring Robert Vaughn (Hustle) alongside Jerry Orbach and Benjamin Bratt

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The murder of a Middle Eastern man sends Briscoe and Curtis racing to thwart a suspected terrorist plot to bring destruction to New York - and leads them to uncover a domestic conspiracy involving horrific female circumcision. Police drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Benjamin Bratt

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: When evidence reveals an NCIS team member is a hitman's latest target, the team members are tasked with searching through old case files to determine who is seeking vengeance. Reeves dies from injuries sustained in the gunfight with the mugger, having instinctively protected Abby, who ends up in the hospital. It transpired the mugger was hired by Robert King, who held a grudge against Abby since his arrest. Looking over Reeves' body in the autopsy room, Abby vows to carry on his wish to start a charity in his native London, deciding to leave NCIS to do so. Pauley Perrette stars

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: While Gibbs attends the memorial service for a friend who was lost at sea, he discovers that the deceased man, Navy Captain Phillip Brooks, had been hiding in a fallout shelter after his boat was attacked and swam to shore. Mark Harmon, David McCallum and Sean Murray star

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Sloane is adamant that a man who held her hostage and tortured her years ago in Afghanistan and was believed to have been killed following her rescue, is alive and in DC, leading Vance and Gibbs to fear she is willing to risk everything to destroy him. Mark Harmon, Maria Bello and Rocky Carroll star

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team investigates the apparent suicide of a retired officer who was in Palmer and Knight's grief group. Torres gets a call from Special Agent Jane Tennant to come to Hawaii

programme.desc: Two surprise sniper attacks on the NYPD leave the SVU squad scrambling for answers. programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit

programme.desc: US Navy captain Jake Marsden is murdered in his hotel room and inquiries lead to marine lieutenant Emma Reynolds - who tells the team she was the intended target. programme.title: Kong: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Kong, Jason, jungle girl Lua, fun-loving Tann and wise Dr. Jenkins take on power-hungry scientists, ferocious prehistoric creatures and incredible magical beings to protect their unique island home

programme.desc: A group of very small dragons live with a kindly old wizard, they're not big enough to fly but that doesn't stop them having many adventures

programme.title: Pocket Dragon Adventures
programme.desc: A group of very small dragons live with a kindly old wizard, they're not big enough to fly but that doesn't stop them having many adventures

programme.title: Department S
programme.desc: A crate is stolen from a secure warehouse. When the tins of fish soup inside are found discarded, the team realise something more valuable was hidden in the warehouse - but what it is, where it is now, and who was trying to steal it are a mystery. Guest starring Patrick Mower (Emmerdale) and Ronald Lacey (Raiders of the Lost Ark)

programme.title: Dispatches
programme.desc: In Britain today, 4.1 million children are growing up in poverty. Dispatches spent a year with three children and their families to show what life is really like if there's just not enough money for life's essentials of food, warmth and a place to call home

programme.title: The Mirror Crack'd (1980)
programme.desc: Miss Marple investigates a murder on a film set starring feuding Hollywood stars Marina Rudd and Lola Brewster. When a local woman dies after drinking a poisoned cocktail made for Marina, everyone assumes the actress was the intended victim because she had received death threats. However, the sleuthing spinster is not convinced. Agatha Christie mystery, with Angela Lansbury, Elizabeth Taylor, Kim Novak and Rock Hudson

programme.title: Calamity the Cow (1967)
programme.desc: A farmer's children prepare a cow for a livestock show, but at the last moment, it is stolen by a rival. Children's comedy, starring John Moulder-Brown and Elizabeth Dear

programme.title: The King and Four Queens (1956)
programme.desc: A gambler visits a ranch owned by the mother of four infamous outlaw brothers. He hopes to discover the location of buried treasure stolen by the criminal family, but finds himself fending off the advances of the bandits' seductive wives, all of whom hope to escape their absent husbands and make off with the loot. Western, with Clark Gable, Eleanor Parker and Jo Van Fleet

programme.title: The Family Way (1966)
programme.desc: A Lancashire man's marriage is complicated by his impotence and the difficulties of living in the same house as his overbearing father. Comedy, starring John Mills and Hywel Bennett

programme.title: Mudlarking the Thames
programme.desc: Nicola White unearths the river's historical treasures

programme.title: My Greek Odyssey
programme.desc: Peter Maneas journeys through some of the most spectacular Greek islands, exploring the rich culture, history and food of Greece while meeting the locals and those who live there

programme.title: Plane Crash Recreated
programme.desc: The story of Air France Flight 447, a scheduled passenger flight from Rio de Janeiro to Paris which dramatically vanished over the Atlantic Ocean in June 2009

programme.title: Tender Mercies (1982)
programme.desc: An alcoholic failed country singer wakes up broke and hungover in a tiny Texas motel. Taking a job at the establishment, he ultimately marries the widowed owner and becomes a father figure to her son. However, when the chance to return to his musical career beckons, he is tempted to abandon his new family. Drama, starring an Oscar-winning Robert Duvall alongside Tess Harper and Ellen Barkin

programme.title: Honour (2014)
programme.desc: A Muslim girl is forbidden from seeing her boyfriend by her traditional parents, but she defies them and the couple run away together. The girl's mother feels the family has been dishonoured, and hires a mysterious bounty hunter to track her down and carry out punishment for her disobedience. Thriller, starring Paddy Considine and Aiysha Hart

programme.title: Radio On (1979)
programme.desc: A DJ drives from London to Bristol to investigate his brother's death, encountering a succession of strange people along the way - but his interest in solving the mystery begins to wane as the journey unfolds. Road movie, starring David Beames, Lisa Kreuzer and Sting

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours for locals and tourists, exploring Elephant & Castle and Croydon. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.desc: A digest of news and events from across London from the past few days.

programme.title: Two Men in a Boat Chasing Spring
programme.desc: Jeremy Norman and his partner Derek Frost charter a motor yacht and set out on an amazing journey, chasing spring up the west coast of the British Isles

programme.title: Two Men in a Boat Chasing Spring
programme.desc: Jeremy Norman and his partner Derek Frost charter a motor yacht and set out on an amazing journey, chasing spring up the west coast of the British Isles

programme.title: Mudlarking the Thames
programme.desc: Nicola White unearths the river's historical treasures

programme.title: Wild Britain with Ray Mears
programme.desc: The survival expert travels along the south coast of the Isle of Wight. He visits a shipwreck that has become a natural habitat for marine species such as the conger eel and spiny spider crab, and with the help of a local angler goes in search of smooth-hound sharks. Back on dry land, Ray finds out how the preserved footprints of an iguanodon reveal the way the dinosaur walked, observes a colony of ravens, and is introduced to the rare Glanville fritillary butterfly

programme.title: Wild Britain with Ray Mears
programme.desc: The survival expert explores the Isles of Scilly off the Cornish coast, where mild temperatures create an ideal habitat for species of wildlife normally associated with warmer climes. Exotic plants like the South African Hottentot fig thrive in the area, while an abundance of insects, including the rare red-barbed ant, means that migrant birds such as barn swallows use the islands as a source of sustenance

programme.title: Grand Tours of the Scottish Islands
programme.desc: Paul Murton sets off from Mallaig to explore a group of islands famous for their unusual names - Rum, Muck and Eigg. Along the way, he meets the real 'Lord Muck', visits the dramatic Kinloch Castle and joins the residents of Eigg as they celebrate their community buyout

programme.title: Grand Tours of the Scottish Islands
programme.desc: Paul Murton continues his island-hopping odyssey, setting sail on an island pilgrimage in the footsteps of saints, visiting Lismore, Colonsay and Oronsay. He hears the story of Saint Moluag, who established a monastery on Lismore, joins writer Alexander McCall Smith on his yacht, and uncovers the secrets revealed by a Viking ship burial on Colonsay

programme.title: Woman in Motion
programme.desc: Nichelle Nichols' campaign to recruit new talent for NASA, which drew the astronauts who became the first Black, Asian and Latin men and women to fly in space

programme.title: Miss Annie Rooney (1942)
programme.desc: A poor family rally round to help their daughter get the perfect dress for her wealthy boyfriend's party. Comedy drama, starring Shirley Temple and William Gargan

programme.title: Tiger in the Smoke (1956)
programme.desc: A criminal gang made up of war veterans is forced by a murderous escaped convict to go in search of hidden treasure. Crime thriller, starring Donald Sinden and Muriel Pavlow

programme.title: Women of Twilight (1952)
programme.desc: A woman moves into a home for unmarried mothers after her boyfriend is charged with murder, but finds the owner sells her tenants' babies. Drama, with Rene Ray and Freda Jackson

programme.title: Tabernacle Choir: Music and Words
programme.desc: Music and inspiration for everyday living, featuring regular guest artists

programme.title: Space 1999
programme.desc: Maya's shapeshifting abilities cause havoc, while the Eagle One gets lost in space. Starring Martin Landau, Barbara Bain and Catherine Schell

programme.title: Wild Britain with Ray Mears
programme.desc: The survival expert visits the Weald on the Kent-Sussex border, where he observes herds of fallow deer with fawns in the medieval royal hunting park of Ashdown Forest, and joins ranger Alice Parfitt to explore the sights the heathland has to offer. Landscape archaeologist Nicola Bannister helps him understand the role of the iron industry in shaping the area

programme.title: Wild Britain with Ray Mears
programme.desc: The survival expert recalls some of his favourite moments from the programme. Beginning the series on the Isle of Mull, he swam with the world's second-largest fish, the basking shark, and observed white-tailed eagle chicks in their nest. He then explored the Yorkshire Dales and Salisbury Plain, took a trip down the River Wye and studied the wildlife of Scotland's west coast. There were also visits to the Weald, and the Isle of Wight, where Ray had the perfect opportunity to film red squirrels and badgers

programme.title: Winged Creatures (2008)
programme.desc: The survivors of a massacre begin to rethink their outlook on life. A compulsive gambler indulges his addiction even further, feeling he has ultimate proof of his good luck. A waitress neglects her baby, a doctor subjects his wife to unusual treatments and a teenager uses her experience to boost her social standing at school. Drama, starring Kate Beckinsale, Forest Whitaker and Guy Pearce

programme.title: Moonwalkers (2015)
programme.desc: A CIA agent travels to London in 1969 on a mission to recruit Stanley Kubrick to fake a moon landing - but is unable to locate the reclusive film-maker. A seedy rock band manager sees a chance to get rich by passing off his friend as Kubrick, but when the ruse is discovered, they have to actually shoot a fake moon landing. Comedy, starring Rupert Grint and Ron Perlman

programme.title: Lioness: The Nicola Adams Story (2021)
programme.desc: Documentary following Nicola Adams, the double Olympic and WBO boxing champion, and the first woman to ever represent England in boxing

programme.title: The Overlap on Tour
programme.desc: Documentary following pundits and ex-footballers Gary Neville, Roy Keane and Jamie Carragher as they embark on a live tour of the UK and Ireland, beginning in Dublin. programme.title: Kenny (2017)
programme.desc: Documentary about the life of former Liverpool player and manager Kenny Dalglish. The film is an intimate and revealing portrait of the Scotsman, who is known at Anfield as 'King Kenny' due to his many achievements with the club. Australia ended an eight-match unbeaten Test run against all opposition for the hosts at this venue with a 251-run triumph here in 2019. England then went on to lose to New Zealand in their next Test here in 2021, but they did end that losing run with a seven-wicket win against India last year
